E-Myth \ 'e-,'mith\ n 1: the entrepreneurial myth: the myth that most people who start small businesses are entrepreneurs 2: the fatal assumption that an individual who understands the technical work of a business can successfully run a business that does that technical work

So it’s been 30 days since we started reading Michael Gerber’s “The eMyth Revisited” as a group and we’re getting together to share the lessons we’ve learned. Some possibilities:

Most new businesses are started by technicians -- people who are skilled at what they enjoy doing.

Technicians assume they understand how a technical business works. In reality, they never do.

Building a business takes three skill sets:

The entrepreneur

The manager

The technician

Three phases of business growth:

Infancy -- when the technician is to the fore.

Expansion -- when better management skills are required.

Maturity -- where an entrepreneurial perspective is needed.

The Turn-Key or Franchise Perspective (even if your business is not a franchise)

The E-Myth Principle Based Business Development Process

Update:

All,

We are looking forward to seeing everyone on Wednesday for our meetup with HP and Akanda. I do want to let everyone know that due to some logistics issues, we will NOT be able to provide food and drinks as we typically do. However, we still expect a great time of learning and networking.

Also, please remember to RSVP by 6 PM today  if you are planning to join us on Wednesday.

Thank you.

Your OpenStack NYC Organizers.

Title:

Transforming Monolithic Apps to Cloud-Native Apps: Lessons Learned

Abstract:

The InternetOfTweets.com was a year old application running on DigitalOcean without Cloud Native design - Hp took this real life application, tore it apart and re-modeled it based on cloud native principles and leveraging micro-services patterns.

In this talk Sujay Maheshwari will share his journey about taking an existing monolithic app to a microservices based design - deployed on HP Helion Development Platform, a distribution of CloudFoundry running on OpenStack

This talk is about approach, learnings and next steps.

Speaker:

Sujay Maheshwari

Developer Evangelist, HP Helion

@taurusismysign

Sujay Maheshwari is a developer evangelist at HP Helion. In the past, he has built his own companies in mobile ad-tech and content marketing space. Prior to that, Sujay was a Project Manager at Morgan Stanley. His biggest fear is his son calling him a tech-illiterate and so he strives hard to learn all the geeky stuff.


Title:

Advanced OpenStack Neutron with Akanda

Abstract:


Mark McClain from Akanda will briefly recap basic Neutron topics around network architecture and common features such as security groups, plugins and agents, then dive in deeper, focusing on advanced services such as Routing and Load Balancing. We will then drill down into typical service provider network designs and the specific technologies in use such as Linuxbridge. We will discuss the Neutron Advanced Services driver model and how it can be useful to Service Providers (and Enterprises) based on our team's experience powering DreamCompute’s networking capabilities using Akanda. We will review Akanda, an open source suite of software, services, orchestration, and tools for providing L3+ services in OpenStack that builds on top of Linux and OpenStack Neutron. Using Akanda, an OpenStack provider can provide tenants with a rich, powerful set of L3+ services. Finally, we will provide an update on the latest discussions heading into Tokyo such as the status of LBaaS, FWaaS as well as the newer Neutron projects such as L2 Gateway, the Neutron Stadium effort and the new Lieutenant system.

Speaker:

Mark McClain

CTO of Akanda  and former Neutron PTL
results.name: Monolithic to Cloud-Native Apps: Lessons Learned by HP/ Neutron with Akanda

results.description:
Hi RECFEN Members!

On October 14th, we are partnering with the NYC REIA group to host an inaugural presentation called Social Marketing & Crowdfunding for Real Estate Investors!  

To get a 100% discount to attend, YOU MUST use promo code PATCH100 when you register on eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/social-marketing-crowdfunding-for-real-estate-investors-tickets-18176678936

If you do not register on eventbrite, you will have to pay full price at the door.

We hope to see many of you there to engage with us again and learn the latest growth hacking tricks that we have used for our own business that we will be sharing with the attendees to grow their own real estate businesses.

Social Marketing and CrowdFunding for Real Estate Investors


Wednesday, October 14, 2015
From 6:00 PM to 9:30 PM
TRYP By Wyndham Hotel, 345 West 35th Street. New York, NY 10001


Meeting Description


In this interactive presentation, learn practical strategies for using social marketing to grow your real estate investing business. We’ll review examples of organizations that have successfully implemented strategies as well as brainstorm ways for participants to use social marketing as a deal flow, lead generation, and financing resource. This presentation will benefit wholesalers looking for more leads, rehabbers to identify more fix and flip opportunities, landlords who need alternative ways to market for tenants & find buy and hold opportunities, and real estate agents, brokers, mortgage professionals, and other service providers market their services better.


Learning Objectives


Lean Startup for Real Estate Investing: Learn how to get your real estate business from concept to reality
Overview of Social Marketing: Identifying the key components of Social Marketing and how to get started with them right away in your own business
Case studies & audience participation: Audience will learn how to apply the step by step funding through case studies & live Q&A segment.

About Your Presenter

Manolis Sfinarolakis is the Founder & CEO of Reality Crowd TV Media Corporation whose mission is to inform, educate, inspire, and motivate entrepreneurs worldwide to start small businesses. Reality Crowd TV helps entrepreneurs with a variety of efforts like crowdfunding including helping to provide a blueprint on how to crowdfund. Since starting Reality Crowd TV Media Corporation, Manolis has helped 10 companies raise $825,000 (as of 12/31/14).


His ability to do so has come from his social media business development skillset coupled with access to journalists and bloggers across industries who are interested in writing about innovative startup companies at the early stages of development.


Manolis also helps manage social media and communities for larger organizations, growing their user base and sales via online media business development. As the community manager of Patch of Land, over $700,000 in gross revenues have been converted to date via his efforts on social media, an enormous return on investment considering the cost of those services accounted for less than 5% of the funds raised.


Manolis understands quickly what needs to be done to take a business to the next level, even if he had not had previous experience within a certain industry. His consultative approach to understanding a business allows both client and consultant to come up with innovative new ways to get the word out about a company and their products or services. He has become a universal marketer and through his network of partners, can achieve virtually any result across mediums per the request of the client.


JOIN US! Remember to use PROMO Code PATCH100 for free admission and please call[masked] with any questions.

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Welcome to Drupal NYC!


Please note that this meetup will be on the 2nd Wednesday of October, not the 1st Wednesday. You must submit your real name when RSVPing or your RSVP will be removed. 

See you on the 14th!


Agenda
• 6:00 - Check-in opens, socializing + pizza
• 6:30 - Announcements
• 6:45 - Introductions
• 7:00 - Lightning Talk #1 - Meet Hubot, our newest team member by Mani Soundararajan
• 7:10 - Lightning Talk #2 - Advocate.com by Dave Johnson 
• 7:20 - Main Talk #1 - Decoupling the Economist by Diana Montalion & Dominic Laycock
• 8:20 - Closing Remarks
• 8:35 - Afterparty @ Bill’s Bar & Burger, concourse bar (1 block north, 16 W. 51st St., accessible via Rockefeller Concourse) https://goo.gl/maps/Eghs2

Talks & Speakers

==========

Lightning Talk #1 - 7:00 - 7:10

Meet Hubot, our newest team member by Mani Soundararajan


Hubot is a friendly bot who will help you run Jenkins builds or move tickets in Jira or even merge pull requests in Github right from your chat room (Slack, Hipchat etc).


Bio:
Mani Soundararajan (@msound) started his programming career when Y2K was still a thing, and has worked on a variety of technologies - Client/Server, Web and a brief stint as an embedded firmware developer. He's been working on Drupal and Web technologies since 2007.


==========


Lightning Talk #2  - 7:10 - 7:20

Advocate.com by Dave Johnson


Here Media is in the process of moving its suite of media sites from Drupal 6 to 7. This talk will concentrate on the relaunch of Advocate.com, an ad-supported site with an average of 4 million monthly uniques. Specific issues will include front-end modifications, content migration, changes in traffic patterns, ad inventory, shared modules and syndication.


Bio:
Dave Johnson ([masked]) is a designer and developer of digital media with a client list that includes Viacom, MTV, Showtime Networks, AOL and Out and Advocate magazines. Dave is currently Creative Director of Digital Media at Here Media. In addition to his web work, Dave has worked in Interactive Television and Video Games and has several games in the permanent collection of The Smithsonian Museum.

==========


Main Talk #1 - 7:20 - 8:20

Decoupling the Economist by Diana Montalion & Dominic Laycock

The Economist is currently served by Drupal 6. Yes, yes, Drupal 6. To meet the content data needs of the multiple Economist products in use, and planned, a decoupled microservices architecture is being designed and built.

The backend is, for the moment, still Drupal 6 with an API added to deliver JSON. The midTier microservices layer uses GoLang. The decoupled, component-based Front End uses Node.js and ReactJS. A side aim of the project is to build a continuous integration environment that will weave the layers together. And a continuous deployment workflow to allow quick changes. 

This talk will give a high-level view of the project then focus specifically on the Drupal challenges involved. The project is in it's infancy, so we plan to give another talk early next year about what went well and what did not.


Bios:
Dominic Laycock (@dtlaycock) is the Technology Manager for the Economist NYC team and the solution architect for the Drupal aspect of the project.


Diana Montalion (@dianamontalion) is a veteran of many enterprise Drupal projects, currently working with the Economist team to architect and implement this revamp. (They also happen to be husband and wife.)


==========

Want to present at Drupal NYC?!
We are always looking for new talks and speakers. If you are interested in presenting at Drupal NYC please message Ben Jeavons, our Speaker Organizer, @ http://www.meetup.com/drupalnyc/members/6722489

Owning several successful businesses since 1993, his current ventures include Talking Alternative Broadcasting, an Internet Radio Station which reaches over 110 countries worldwide, The Conscious Consultant, a coaching and mentoring service which promotes sensible, ethical, and conscious ways to build careers and businesses, and Double Diamond Wellness, a healing center.  Sam has lectured in several venues including, The New York City Job Fair, Lee Hecht Harrison/DBM Outplacement Solutions, East West Books, Quest Bookshop, The A.R.E.- Edgar Cayce Center of New York, and was a featured speaker at the NY Business Expo.

Venmo is a free service that lets you send and receive money right from your smartphone using your card, bank, or Venmo balance, and send the payments you receive to your bank overnight.  We're building a product that people love, and we strive to create a delightful user experience while connecting the world and empowering people through payments. Internally, we take pride in our inclusive and open culture. Our focus on continual learning and development feeds a group that's insatiably curious, and allows us to continue inspiring each other to be our best. We value team-players who enjoy hard work and good-hearted fun. As a result, our collaborative work style and lively group events make for a productive, close-knit team.  Check out our open positions!

results.description:
Social Marketing & CrowdFunding for Real Estate Investors

Wednesday, October 14, 2015

From 6:00 PM to 9:30 PM

TRYP By Wyndham Hotel, 345 West 35th Street. New York, NY 10001

Your Investment:

Members:  $15 / Guests: $30 (Onsite Registration More)

Register Here: https://socialmarketingforinvestors.eventbrite.com


Meeting Description

In this interactive presentation, learn practical strategies for using social marketing to grow your real estate investing business. We’ll review examples of organizations that have successfully implemented strategies as well as brainstorm ways for participants to use social marketing as a deal flow, lead generation, and financing resource. This presentation will benefit wholesalers looking for more leads, rehabbers to identify more fix and flip opportunities, landlords who need alternative ways to market for tenants & find buy and hold opportunities, and real estate agents, brokers, mortgage professionals, and other service providers market their services better.

Learning Objectives

Lean Startup for Real Estate Investing: Learn how to get your real estate business from concept to reality

Overview of Social Marketing: Identifying the key components of Social Marketing and how to get started with them right away in your own business

Case studies & audience participation: Audience will learn how to apply the step by step funding through case studies & live Q&A segment.

About Presenter

Manolis Sfinarolakis is the Founder & CEO of Reality Crowd TV Media Corporation whose mission is to inform, educate, inspire, and motivate entrepreneurs worldwide to start small businesses. Reality Crowd TV helps entrepreneurs with a variety of efforts like crowdfunding including helping to provide a blueprint on how to crowdfund.  Since starting Reality Crowd TV Media Corporation, Manolis has helped 10 companies raise $825,000 (as of 12/31/14).

His ability to do so has come from his social media business development skillset coupled with access to journalists and bloggers across industries who are interested in writing about innovative startup companies at the early stages of development.

Manolis also helps manage social media and communities for larger organizations, growing their user base and sales via online media business development.  As the community manager of Patch of Land, over $700,000 in gross revenues have been converted to date via his efforts on social media, an enormous return on investment considering the cost of those services accounted for less than 5% of the funds raised.

Manolis understands quickly what needs to be done to take a business to the next level, even if he had not had previous experience within a certain industry.  His consultative approach to understanding a business allows both client and consultant to come up with innovative new ways to get the word out about a company and their products or services.  He has become a universal marketer and through his network of partners, can achieve virtually any result across mediums per the request of the client.

RSVP HERE

results.description:
This meetup group was started by the founder of the DaniWeb.com IT Discussion Community who was getting frustrated that all of the meetups she was interested in attending were based in NYC, and it was nearly impossible to get to them on weeknights for people who work out on Long Island.

Join a group of people who work in the tech industry throughout Long Island.

We are a very informal group consisting mostly of web developers and IT consultants, with the occasional application developer thrown into the mix. We talk about the latest projects we're working on and get help and feedback from each other.

The meetup starts at 6 pm but running as late as 10 or 11 pm (sometimes even later!) is the norm. People typically arrive anytime between 6 pm and 9 pm, so don't miss out just because you can't get there by 6. There's usually an early crowd and a late crowd.
results.how_to_find_us: Parking on Bell Blvd. is not metered after 7 pm. We are located in office space above Clifford Optical and the Allergy and Asthma Family Care Center. We have our own door leading upstairs to the right of the medical office.
results.name: DaniWeb Techie Meetup - 2nd Wed of the Month

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be either in the private room or the main room. Either way look for the people playing games!
results.name: Victory Pints at Berg'n Beer Hall

group.name: Victory Pints: Board Games and Beer

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
iMakr will be offering free 3D printing training at the iMakr Store in New York.

This training is best suited for people who are looking at purchasing a 3D printer, or are just interested in the technology, and want to learn more about the machines and software.  

The iMakr Store is located at 152 Allen Street, Lower East Side.

The following points will be covered during the training session:

• Intro to 3D Printing - What to look for in a Printer?

• Intro to the printer - Ultimaker 2

• Intro to the Software (slicer)

• Ongoing maintenance 


• Common troubles

• Workflow, tips and tricks

If you have any question, please email us at [masked]

We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: How to 3D print with HyVision Cubicon

results.description:
Event is free to attend and includes 1 drink ticket!

Register Here, by October 13: www.sempo.org/event/cities_newyork_2015

The Connected Consumer: How to align your mobile marketing strategy with consumer intent to drive engagement and conversion throughout the buyer journey

As we approach the holiday season, marketers are constantly duking it out with their competitors in order to be at the forefront of their potential customer's mind. That feat is made more difficult when today's consumer is constantly on the move. As more search is being done on mobile devices, marketers must be able to cut through all the clutter to get themselves in front of the consumer, at the right time.

With the See. Think. Do. Care. framework, determine how to effectively deliver the most relevant message to the consumer at the right time, using the right messaging and method for the always on the go consumer.

Agenda:

6.00 – 6.30: Arrival, drinks, food, and networking

6.30 – 7.00: Panel discussion

7.00 – 7.15: Q&A

7.15 – 8.00: Networking 

Event is free to attend and includes 1 drink ticket!

Register Here, by October 13: www.sempo.org/event/cities_newyork_2015

While you are it, please take a minute to become a member of SEMPO. It is only $125 and it helps us organizing free events such as this one: www.sempo.org/join

Note - RSVP on MeetUp does not guarantee registration. Please register on sempo.org.
results.how_to_find_us: 4th Floor of Google New York HQ

results.description:
Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.

results.description:
Please note the change of time! We'll meet at the Main Street School parking lot for a loop run to Tarrytown and back. This is a lovely twilight run with Hudson River views. Total distance is just over 4 miles.

Details about the run

Route: As the sun is setting earlier now, we’ll leave promptly at 6 pm from the Main Street School parking lot. We'll head north on the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail, and turn left (west) at the Lyndhurst greenhouses to connect to the Riverwalk. At the Riverwalk we'll continue north to Van Wart Ave, before turning right (east) to return to Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A tentative route map is available here. 

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: Main Street School parking lot (101 Main St)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Tarrytown Loop

results.description:
Breakups can be agonizing. The end of a relationship can trigger loneliness, regret, increased stress, lower self-esteem and a decline in health. Join me for coffee and a discussion on how to get you through this time and move forward with strength, confidence and a positive outlook.

There is no charge for this meet-up but each member is responsible for their own dining expenses :)
results.name: Breakup Coaching

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.

Please bring $4 cash to the game. 

• RSVPs close by 4:00PM on the day of the game. 

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP by midnight the day before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club programs or activities.

venue.name: Hunter College School of Social Work

results.description:
Hunter East Harlem Gallery at Hunter College is pleased to present the exhibition; If You Leave Me Can I Come Too? The group exhibition showcases artworks that reveal the power and beauty that arise from the acknowledgement of death. The show features 12 international contemporary artists working in a variety of media, including photography, sculpture, installation, and video. Presented at Hunter East Harlem Gallery.

An exhibition where death inspires life, the exhibition draws its title from a painting by exhibiting artist Friedrich Kunath. Seen as a question the exhibition seeks to expose, either directly or symbolically, a prompt for conversation around the particularly taboo subject of death in contemporary society. The exhibition vision sidesteps the funerary, scientific, and darker aspects often associated with death in favor of showcasing the powerful, communal and human qualities that are also inherent to the passing of life.


Our Meetup

We will meet in the Gallery at Hunter College School of Social Work on 2180 Third Avenue (119th Street) in East Harlem at 6:00pm. Members of the group should be easy to spot, but feel free to ask for me (Daniel) or Arden and as always, call or text me at[masked] if you have any questions.

Directions to Hunter College School of Social Work

Take the #6 train to 116th Street, then walk to 119th & Third Avenue. The M100, M101, M102, & M116 bus stops are also nearby.

About Hunter College East Harlem Gallery

Hunter East Harlem is a multi-disciplinary space for art exhibitions and socially engaged projects. Located on the ground floor of Hunter College’s Silberman School of Social Work at 119th Street and 3rd Avenue, the gallery presents exhibitions and public events that aim to foster academic collaborations at Hunter College while addressing subjects relevant to the East Harlem community and greater New York City. The gallery specifically seeks to initiate partnerships with publicly oriented organizations and focuses on showcasing artists who are engaging in social practice, public interventions, community projects, and alternative forms of public art. All exhibitions and programs are free and open to the public.
results.how_to_find_us: Inside the Gallery Area
results.name: "If You Leave Me Can I Come Too?" Opening Reception @ Hunter College East Harlem

results.description:
Come join us for a night of board gaming fun. We play all sorts of board games and card games. We tend to play more euro games so please keep that in mind. Bringing a game is not necessary, but if you have one you want to play bring it along.

Valley Stream train station is very close about three blocks.

For those who drive:

• Street parking meters are until 6pm. If you come early, W. Jamaica Ave has a free parking lot, behind the pizzeria.


We have permission from the restaurant owner to play in the restaurant on the condition that everyone consumes something. At least a soda. The restaurant also has a bakery attached with treats.

We play in the restaurant; to get there, you enter the bakery walk to the back, then make a right. There you'll find the restaurant, we are located by the front windows.

• The bakery is located across the street from Mitchell's restaurant. There is a lighted OPEN sign on the window.

• Be aware this group has an age limit, those who come to game must be adults under 40**

**Due to popular demand we will now be having a 3 no show rule. If you RSVP but can't make it please take the time to take yourself off. Our group is small and we do plan our games on how many members will be showing up. Even if you unrsvp right before we start, one of us is always checking and we appreciate the info. I'll send you a warning after the 2nd no show, but after the third I'll have to take you out of our group.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be located inside the restaurant section by the windows
results.name: Wednesday board gaming in Valley Stream

results.description:
Computers:  Our Basic Computer courses are centered around student needs. We offer levels 1 and 2 depending on the class size and skill level. Our teachers combine their computer knowledge and love of teaching to create a classroom environment that caters to all students with a variety of interests and skill levels.

Computers 1 focuses on how to operate a PC, using a mouse, typing, navigating a web browser, creating an e-mail, and changing computer settings.
Computers 2 focuses on using social media, Youtube, sending and receiving pictures, Microsoft Office (excluding Powerpoint), and typing practice.

Computadoras: Nuestros cursos básicos de sistemas de computadora se centran en las necesidades del estudiante. Ofrecemos los niveles 1 y 2 en función del tamaño de la clase y nivel de habilidad. Los profesores combinarán su conocimiento de la computadora y el amor de la enseñanza para crear un ambiente de clase que proporciona a los estudiantes con practica para una variedad de intereses y habilidades.

Computadoras Nivel 1 se centra en las instrucciones basicas para operar una PC - utilizar el ratón, escribir, navegar por un navegador web, la creación de un e-mail, y el cambio de la configuración del equipo.Computadoras 2 se centra en el uso de las redes sociales, You Tube, enviar y recibir imágenes, Microsoft Office (excluyendo PowerPoint), y práctica del teclado.
results.name: Basic Computers/ Computadoras

results.description:
Host:  "Conversations New York."  http://www.meetup.com/Conversations-New-York/events/225533057/

Please join us to preview, discuss and apply the findings and recommendations of RECLAIMING CONVERSATION: The Power of Talk in a Digital Age, to be published on Oct. 6 (and previewed on the cover of the New York Times Sunday Review on Sept. 27). We’ll explore Prof. Turkle’s 13 specific recommendations for “turning away from our devices and back to each other.” Blurbing this book, comedian Aziz Ansari, author of Modern Romance, says: “Sherry Turkle helps explain what the f*** is going on.”

And of course we’ll also have fun with our usual festivities, including a raffle to win an “Art of Conversation” deck of cards, and honoring an outstanding contributor with our prestigious Plato Award ("...and this month's award goes to....")

About the Moderator:

 Ron Gross is the founder of "Conversations New York." He's been organizing exciting, important CONVERSATIONS for 20 years, and currently holds them regularly on the Columbia University campus and elsewhere through the city. He's the author of 23 books on LIFELONG LEARNING. He was recently honored for lifetime achievement in the field by the International Society for Self-Directed Learning. The late Buckminster Fuller said of Ron's work: “If humanity is to pass safely through its present crisis on earth, it will be because a majority of individuals are now doing their own thinking. Ronald Gross’ work has pioneered in improving the climate for such thinking in the United States.”
results.name: “RECLAIMING CONVERSATION”: Seminar/Workshop on the book by Sherry with Ron Gross

results.description:
*THERE IS A MANDATORY $15 MINIMUM PURCHASE OF FOOD OR DRINK AT THIS EVENT*

*

Let's grab a bite to eat, maybe some drinks, and play some games! Yes, there are games you may never have heard of ... Splendor, Cash and Guns, Age of War, Imperial Settlers, Upon a Fable and many many more!! Not to worry! People who bring the games will teach you how to play.  If you have a game you want to play, bring it along! 


We will get there between 6 and 6:30, have a bite to eat and then bring out the games!!  But, if you can't get there until later, no problem.  We'll be there for several hours.   Don't want to eat dinner there?  No problem, you can order some drinks.  Just keep in mind ... each attendee is required to purchase at least $15 of food or drinks.

If anyone has a specific game they wish to play,  feel free to ask.  And again, if you want to bring one of your own games, that's cool too!  As a matter of fact, it's encouraged!  ;-)

results.description:
All of us ... Bisexual/Non-Monosexual, Multisexual, Queer, Questioning, Label-less and just plain old Bi-friendly ...

We need a community that is social and safe and fun. We need a circle of couches in the "cafeteria of life" where we can hang out with people who are like ourselves and be free from judgment and social stigma.

That's what this meetup is all about: creating our own community.

•           ~~~~~~

Starting Jan 2014 we inaugurate a low pressure meeting for our community.


It's been happen on the 2nd Wednesday of every month. We are holding court, downstairs, all the way back at Madame X.

This is a buy your own drinks event... if we are hungry we might get round a paper menu or someone cell phone and order delivery from some place nearby.

•           ~~~~~~

Madame X is in Manhattan, on the north side of West Houston Street .. a short walk from Spring Street subway stop on the C, or any subways stopping at Broadway-Lafayette or West 4th Street.

Questions? Nudge Paul ... 

•  via email, [masked], well in advance of the meeting... 

•  on his cell phone,[masked], if it's the day of the event.
results.how_to_find_us: Just come all the way back in the downstairs lounge... you can't miss us. :-)

results.description:
Tom is a seasoned venture capitalist and is now running Newark Venture Partners as socially responsible fund with Amazon.com and the state of NJ as co-investors.  


Tom also co-manages RosePaul Investments, a family office, and its proprietary fund, RosePaul Ventures that invests in tech start-ups and VC/PE funds. RosePaul's tech start-up portfolio is focused on software enabled business. 

Tom is also an active early stage investor and advisor to start-ups, venture capital, private equity and growth-stage companies. He is a member of the board of directors for New York Angels, a early stage investment group. He serves as a board member and advisor to a number of early stage ventures. 

Prior to this he was a Partner at the management consulting firm Baldwin Bell Green (BBG) where he focused on Financial Services, Technology and Private Equity clients. The majority of this work focused on advising senior management in the areas of Strategy, Operations and IT. 

Prior to joining Baldwin Bell Green in 2008, Tom worked independently for 7 years as an advisor to private equity/venture capital firms and on two occasions joined the management team of a portfolio company. Prior to 2000, he spent 7 years as a management consultant at Mitchell Madison Group where he was a Partner. Prior to business school, he worked at Morgan Stanley in technology development and investment banking.

Agenda for the evening is as follows:


6:30 to 7:00 Pizza & Networking


7:00 to 7:10 Updates

7:10 to 7:20 Audience/Member Announcements and Requests

7:20 to 7:30 Kevin Celisca co-founder Integrate 

7:40 to 7:50 Connor Leszczuk Owner Aspekt Aerial


7:50 to 8:30 Keynote speaker:  Angel Investor / Venture Capitalist and Tom Wisniewski 


8:30 to 9:00 Networking

After 9:00   Drinks at Vanderbilt's in the Hamilton Park Hotel https://maps.google.com/maps?expflags%3Denable_star_based_justifications:true%26ie%3DUTF8%26cid%3D16356950445471689601%26q%3DHamilton%2BPark%2BHotel%2B%2526%2BConference%2BCenter%26iwloc%3DA%26gl%3DUS%26hl%3Den">175 Park Ave Florham Park, NJ 07932 - Just exit through the Florham Road / Park Ave exit of FDU and you will see the Hotel on the left before you reach Park Ave. 

Directions - Complete directions to the FDU library are available here - http://view.fdu.edu/files/directionstolibrarymonningercenterandorangerie.pdf

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

A scavenger hunt and party rolled into one! Join us for this fun evening where you will get to meet awesome people, explore one of NYC's iconic landmarks and enjoy a great party with the friends you have already made on the Scavenger Hunt!   It is a fun and different way to spend a Wednesday.

How it works:  Join us for check in from 6:30-7pm at Lexington's Lounge in the Cort Hotel on 39th and Lexington.  Have a drink, socialize and unwind from the days work.  Upon check-in we’ll group people together into teams of 4 or 5.  One person in your group will need to have a camera or camera phone.  After we have everyone checked in you will have 75 minutes to find all the clues we have sent you out to find!

At the end of 75 minutes your team will come back to Lexington's for food, drink and fun conversations about what you just experienced. We will tally up the scores and announce the winners.

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

Cost: $10  Please bring exact change

Level: No prior knowledge needed of anything… just have fun.

Can I come alone?  Yes most attending will have signed up on their own.

What to wear: Anything (but you may find yourself running)

What to bring: A charged phone or Android device (don’t worry if you don’t have one, we’ll group you into a team that does)

What’s included?
- A fun and crazy time playing
- Meeting new people
- Prizes

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Grand Central Scavenger Hunt & After Work Party

results.description:
Speed Painting Night - Paint, Socialize, Make New Friends! (Must Pre-Pay Online)

Get your tickets at: http://www.clickmixers.com/speedpainting.html

* This is not an Asian specific event. All are welcome to attend.

So what's Speed Painting? Come on out and sip on cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. This event is for singles only (not couples). Upon entering you will be seated at a paint station along side another painter. We encourage you to say hi and make new a friend. We will rotate you (with your canvas) a few times throughout the night so you get to paint and chat with several other people... This makes for a great, fun social experience! While this event is geared toward singles, We don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with) and possibly even end up meeting that special someone.


Typically about 80% of attendees of this event come alone and 20% bring a friend. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to a painting night!

TICKET PRICE: $37
Get your tickets at: http://www.clickmixers.com/speedpainting.html

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

Get your tickets at: http://www.clickmixers.com/speedpainting.html
results.name: Speed Painting Night - Paint, Socialize, Make New Friends! (Must Pre-Pay Online)

Session 2 - Will feature model MARIAELENA from 7:40-8:40pm (She will be doing a stylish dress, swimwear and lingerie)

Session 3 - Will feature MARIE from 8:50-9:50pm (She will be doing  a fashionable form fitting dress, lingerie and nude) 

============================================== 

PAYMENT

==============================================

The payment will be broken down into 2 parts if you're not doing early registration.  

Part 1 is the $20 payment to reserve your spot which needs to be completed by Monday, October 12th through Paypal at [masked] (ManattanGroupPhotographyShootout at live dot com) (Let me know which session you're paying for)

Part 2 is the $30 (1 session) or $80 (2 sessions) or $130 (3 sessions) which must be paid in cash at the door immediately upon arrival to the event.

Payment options

Lighting Equipment, Props and Furniture

* Seamless paper (white or gray) (Subject to availability) 

* Props (Bench, couch, apple crates, wooden stool and step ladder) (Subject to availability) 

Additional Info 

* Tipping the model for a job well done is greatly appreciated even if it's $5 

============================================== 

Refund Policy 

All sales are finals. If a model doesn't show up, either an alternate model will be used or the remaining model will pose for both sessions.  Refunds will be given only if the event gets cancelled or all models are a no show.

results.description:
You are invited to join the newly created HR in Tech Book Club. For our first book, we have selected "Work Rules!" by Laszlo Bock, Google's Head of People Operations, as recommended by Spencer Jacobson from BetterWorks at a recent meet-up event. 

Prior to our meeting on Oct 14, please read through chapters 1-8. We will use the themes in our readings as a springboard to discuss the issues we face or the changes we wish to make in our organizations.


A big thank you to BetterWorks! They will be providing the venue for our discussion. 

At the moment, space will be limited to 12 participants to allow for organized discussions. Please email Janna, [masked], with event questions.


We look forward to seeing you soon!

---

Buy "Work Rules!" here:
http://smile.amazon.com/Work-Rules-Insights-Inside-Transform/dp/1444792369/ref=tmm_pap_swatch_0?_encoding=UTF8&qid=1442422191&sr=8-1


More about "Work Rules!":


NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER
WALL STREET JOURNAL BESTSELLER

"We spend more time working than doing anything else in life. It's not right that the experience of work should be so demotivating and dehumanizing." So says Laszlo Bock, head of People Operations at the company that transformed how the world interacts with knowledge. 

This insight is the heart of WORK RULES!, a compelling and surprisingly playful manifesto that offers lessons including:

• Take away managers' power over employees 

• Learn from your best employees-and your worst 

• Hire only people who are smarter than you are, no matter how long it takes to find them 

• Pay unfairly (it's more fair!) 

• Don't trust your gut: Use data to predict and shape the future 

• Default to open-be transparent and welcome feedback 

• If you're comfortable with the amount of freedom you've given your employees, you haven't gone far enough.

Drawing on the latest research in behavioral economics and a profound grasp of human psychology, WORK RULES! also provides teaching examples from a range of industries-including lauded companies that happen to be hideous places to work and little-known companies that achieve spectacular results by valuing and listening to their employees. Bock takes us inside one of history's most explosively successful businesses to reveal why Google is consistently rated one of the best places to work in the world, distilling 15 years of intensive worker R&D into principles that are easy to put into action, whether you're a team of one or a team of thousands.

Read it to build a better company from within rather than from above; read it to reawaken your joy in what you do.
results.name: Hr in Tech Book Club presents: "Work Rules!" (Part 1 of 2)

results.description:
Speed Painting Night - Paint, Socialize, Make New Friends! (Must Pre-Pay Online)

Get your tickets at: http://www.clickmixers.com/speedpainting.html

So what's Speed Painting? Come on out and sip on cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. This event is for singles only (not couples). Upon entering you will be seated at a paint station along side another painter. We encourage you to say hi and make new a friend. We will rotate you (with your canvas) a few times throughout the night so you get to paint and chat with several other people... This makes for a great, fun social experience! While this event is geared toward singles, We don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with) and possibly even end up meeting that special someone.


Typically about 80% of attendees of this event come alone and 20% bring a friend. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to a painting night!

TICKET PRICE: $37
Get your tickets at: http://www.clickmixers.com/speedpainting.html

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

Get your tickets at: http://www.clickmixers.com/speedpainting.html

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.
results.name: Hardware Hack Lab

results.description:
Prospecting can take its toll and the constant rejection can take a toll.  To that end, having a supportive sales culture can make all the difference in preventing SDR burnout.

This month we will have a special guest speaker, Matt Heiss from Poppin, to discuss how they created a unique culture for their sales team.  Some the initiatives focused on the processes and technologies they implemented to improve sales efficiency and other efforts focused more on motivation and building a culture of collaboration and support across the team.
results.name: Fostering a Strong SDR Culture

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

A scavenger hunt and party rolled into one! Join us for this fun evening where you will get to meet awesome people, explore one of NYC's iconic landmarks and enjoy a great party with the friends you have already made on the Scavenger Hunt!   It is a fun and different way to spend a Wednesday.

How it works:  Join us for check in from 6:30-7pm at Lexington's Lounge in the Cort Hotel on 39th and Lexington.  Have a drink, socialize and unwind from the days work.  Upon check-in we’ll group people together into teams of 4 or 5.  One person in your group will need to have a camera or camera phone.  After we have everyone checked in you will have 75 minutes to find all the clues we have sent you out to find!

At the end of 75 minutes your team will come back to Lexington's for food, drink and fun conversations about what you just experienced. We will tally up the scores and announce the winners.

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

Cost: $10  Please bring exact change

Level: No prior knowledge needed of anything… just have fun.

Can I come alone?  Yes most attending will have signed up on their own.

What to wear: Anything (but you may find yourself running)

What to bring: A charged phone or Android device (don’t worry if you don’t have one, we’ll group you into a team that does)

What’s included?
- A fun and crazy time playing
- Meeting new people
- Prizes

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Grand Central Scavenger Hunt & After Work Party

venue.name: Real Estate Investing Office

results.description:
Are you tired of just working your day to day grind and just getting by? Why not find out how you can get out of the rat race?

The game of Cashflow simulates real-life financial management and features realistic Real Estate investing scenarios designed to show you how these types of transactions work in real life and both helps you learn how to effectively utilize them in their investing strategies. It also helps to find out your investing style, whether you are aggressive in your strategies or conservative so we can see in which of these you are most comfortable. All without the pressures of using your own money.

We will be meeting at our real estate investing office in Manhattan
results.how_to_find_us: include your email address and phone number when you register for this event and we will contact you.
results.name: Let the Cash-Flow

If you would like to participate in all 3 sessions the price is $150. (Early registration price is $120.)


==============================================


Early Registration

Early registration is available if you pay the entire amount ($40 for 1 session or $80 for 2 sessions or $120 for 3 sessions) by Sunday, October 11th. 

Here's the Paypal link if you're paying during early registration:

Early Registration - 1 Session ($40)

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=56ZD8UP6S7LQY 

Early Registration - 2 Sessions ($80) 

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=GWMNT46VKZ84Y 

Early Registration - 3 Sessions ($120) 

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=38R7V3CAWSBSW 

==============================================

The payment will be broken down into 2 parts if you're not doing early registration. 


Part 1 is the $20 payment to reserve your spot which needs to be completed by Monday, October 12th through Paypal at [masked] (ManattanGroupPhotographyShootout at live dot com) (Let me know which session you're paying for)

Part 2 is the $30 (1 session) or $80 (2 sessions) or $130 (3 sessions) which must be paid in cash at the door immediately upon arrival to the event.

==============================================


Payment options

1.  Send Paypal payment to [masked] (ManattanGroupPhotographyShootout at live dot com) (Let me know which session you're paying for)

2. Click the Paypal link in the message

3.  Stop by the studio on Thursday after 6pm and pay cash (You must let me know first if you're coming)

==============================================


Model Release 

The model release is mandatory and is included in the price of the workshop.

2257 Compliance Forms

The 2257 age verification form is mandatory and is included in the price of the workshop for Marie.

Lighting Equipment, Props and Furniture 

* 2 daylight balanced continuous lights (Feel free to bring your lights as well and we'll try to accommodate as long as it doesn't interfere with the other photographers) 

* Seamless paper (white or gray) (Subject to availability) 

* Props (Bench, couch, apple crates, wooden stool and step ladder) (Subject to availability) 

Additional Info 

* Tipping the model for a job well done is greatly appreciated even if it's $5 

==============================================


Refund Policy 

All sales are finals. If a model doesn't show up, either an alternate model will be used or the remaining model will pose for both sessions.  Refunds will be given only if the event gets cancelled or all models are a no show.

==============================================


* AT THE DOOR SALES PRICES WILL BE HIGHER

** YOU ARE ONLY ALLOWED TO SHOOT AND STAY FOR THE SESSION YOU PAID FOR!!

*** PLEASE ARRIVE NO EARLIER THAN 5 MINUTES BEFORE THE START TIMES (THERE'S NO SPACE TO HANG OUT IN THE STUDIO BEFORE THE WORKSHOP BEGINS)

**** YOU ARE ONLY CONFIRMED IF YOU PAID!!!!!!

results.description:
Are you Looking to get fit?


Need to drop a few pounds?

Want to get in shape for the summer?


Try a FREE class at CrossFit Outbreak


Our classes are designed to introduce you to CrossFit. We want to get you fit and healthy, challenge your mind and  body - we love to  MAKE FITNESS FUN.


The first class is free.


There is no obligation to join our gym outside of this class. 


The Exercises: CrossFit is a combination of strength, cardio, muscle endurance, flexibility, core, and functional movement patterns. You get EVERYTHING you need!


Time Efficient Training. Our classes are 60 minutes in length. We utilize the principle of muscle confusion. You will NEVER do the same workout twice! Why is this good? Because…your body will never adapt and you will keep on getting stronger and fitter.


Make sure to click on the link below to register for the class and sign our waiver form ---> 


http://crossfitoutbreak.wodify.com/MembershipSales/ViewSchedule.aspx?LocationId=1895&IsMobile=False&OnlineMembershipId=14804

results.description:
We all carry a story within us. Join a community of filmmakers to make your vision a reality. Our new shared approach radically lowers the cost of filmmaking.

Learn the Craft of Filmmaking
Improve your filmmaking skills by taking a "learn by doing" approach to making movies. Beginners to Experts welcome.


Networking
Network with local filmmakers. If you're looking to meet, network, or work with filmmakers, The NYC Film Co-op is the place to find them.

Make Movies
We're all about making films. We work together on each other's films, leveraging our collective skills, equipment, and resources.

Pitch Your Idea
Every NYC Film Co-Op film starts with a pitch. Any member can pitch their idea to the rest of the group and the ideas that attract the crew get made. Any genre, any topic.

We have pitch meetings every month, a writer's group to help you refine your story, and classes to help you plan and make your movie (or web series, documentary).

Create your Movie
Now it's magic time. Once you get your crew, you're on the fast path to making your film. NYC Film Co-Op is filled with the people who can help - from equipment to skills, everyone is working together to make the best film possible.

Whatever skills you're looking to improve, there are plenty of opportunities to do so. With 10 films concurrently in production you're bound to learn a lot - fast.

Screenings
Every film that goes through the Film Co-Op is screened. There's nothing quite like seeing your masterpiece up on the big screen for everyone to see.
results.name: PITCH your IDEA, form a TEAM, NETWORK and CREATE

results.description:
Every month Film Co-Op members get together for a pitch meeting. Pitches for films or web series are made, crews are formed and the filmmaking process starts.

It is a simple process. Any member can pitch a film or web series idea that they need help on. In three minutes they express the idea, describe the crew positions they need and get people interested in their project.

Once all the pitches are heard you will have time to mingle with others and talk to the owner about working about their project.

results.description:
Cool new products <> cool product people. Bringing together New York's makers. 

This month's collection: Keyboards

6:30 - 7:30pm  -  Mix and mingle with fellow Product Hunters.

7:30 - 8:30pm - Founders share their experience building and growing their products. Less demos. More lessons learned. 


Happy hour afterwards at Brass Monkey roof.

Featured  Hunts:

Co-founders Slash Keyboard, Cem Kozinglu & Nick Barr

A top hunt two weeks ago, Slash keyboard makes it easy to share anything, without switching apps. Simply type "/contacts" to share a contact or "/spotify" to share a song. Fred Wilson called it an exciting return to the command line interface. 

Product Manager Sunrise, Alice Default

Meet is a keyboard for Android and iOS that lets you select available time slots in your calendar to schedule one-to-ones. Sunrise is a hugely popular calendar app that was recently purchased by Microsoft. 

Director of Biz Dev Giphy, David Rosenberg 

Giphy is the world's largest search engine for GIFs. They have accelerated growth by integrating their GIFs into popular message and keyboard apps like Slack, Slash and Facebook Messenger. 

Disclaimer: This is a community organized event by Swig Labs. We're friends with the Product Hunt guys but they're not directly organizing this event (they do stop by sometimes).
results.name: Product Hunt NYC: The Future Keyboard

results.description:
Missed your train? Spilled your coffee on yourself before you got to the office? Leave that all behind and start your day over at our Office Hours event.

The event is open to all ages, genders and technical abilities. Bring your tech questions, resume, pet projects, or just join us! We are language and tool agnostic, offering a safe and welcoming environment for tech professionals and hobbyists, recruiters and hiring managers.

We will be doing light presentations and hands-on workshops in bash shell and other *NIX concepts. Experienced geeks will be present to answer tech questions and host open discussions. Recruiters and hiring managers will be available to review your resume, and provide tips to getting your next job. They will not approach you, you can choose to approach them.

We guarantee your anonymity and privacy, as well as guaranteeing that you get to choose whether or not to interact with recruiters and hiring managers. We will never give away or sell your personal info. Optionally, if you choose to provide an email address we will send you GeekMeet notifications about upcoming events. Building security needs your real name, but no one else does, nor will anyone else see it.

If you are a recruiter and hiring manager, contact us for details if you wish to sponsor pizza and beverages, and be present at our event. You will have a few minutes to share what you do. Afterwards, people will have the option of approaching you.
results.name: GeekMeet NYC Office Hours

We're bringing back two of our most popular demos to celebrate the launch of our new "Demo Deep Dive" event series. During this intimate fireside chat, members will get to know two of New York's most promising health-tech startups, Addicaid and Pager. You'll hear more about their founder's backgrounds, the legal obstacles of building tech within the healthcare system, and will even be allowed to ask the forbidden question- "What's your business model?"

ABOUT ADDICAID
Addicaid is a personalized treatment for addiction and dependence disorders. 
addicaid.com
@addicaid
Speaker: Sam Frons, Founder/ CEO 

Addicaid Demo at NYTM - August 2015
http://embed.wirewax.com/8018366/FF0044/?autoStart=true

ABOUT PAGER
Pager is the mobile app bringing board-certified doctors to your home or office when you’re sick or injured.
pager.com 
@getpager
Speaker: Toby Hervey, General Manager

Pager Demo at NYTM - February 2015 
Demo starts at timestamp 8:30
http://embed.wirewax.com/8013560/7bafa8/?autoStart=true

About the Venue
Created by the Downtown Alliance and designed by Gensler, LOWER MANHATTAN HQ (LMHQ) is a collaboration space for Lower Manhattan's creatives and creators. Located at 150 Broadway, companies can come together here to collaborate, activate and accelerate their growth. LMHQ is a new kind of working environment featuring event space with state of the art A/V, public programming exploring innovations in various industries, meeting & brainstorming rooms, workspace, coffee bar and on-site tech support. Meet us at LMHQ, and do more than just work.

results.description: Black Church, Inc. is an investigative documentary that examines the excess of the black church and its present day relationship with serving the community. The documentary compares the black church's origins to its modern day cultural relevance. The film focuses on modern mega-churches and asks questions about service vs. the extravagant lifestyles of its million dollar ministers and ministries.

results.description:
Please join us to celebrate the Opening Reception of:

Opulence Á La Maison D’Art

by Javier Ávila

Wed. Oct. 14, 6:30-9PM

@ La Maison D’Art Gallery, 259 West 132nd Street, NY NY 10027 (Between ADC/FDB)

This exhibit’s opening brings a spectrum full of color, power and whimsy. Inspirational muses take form in a preview of the artist’s larger collection of iconic women entitled Opulent Icons. Eight pieces from the collection will be on view at La Maison D’Art Gallery through November 25th. Also on view will be prints and Collage work by the artist. There will be scheduled Artists talks, Dia de Los Muertos Tribute Event and Supreme Saturday a joyous musical tribute to the music of The Supremes.

Emerging painter, Javier Ávila , displays large-scale, colorful, powerful and playful portraits of famous, glamorous and influential women. Some of these disciples of Glamour in the cast of this series include: The Supremes, Madonna, Elizabeth Taylor, Chér, Sophia Loren, María Félix, Joséphine Baker, Jennifer Lopéz and Audrey Hepburn.

Each Icon is personalized through color, text—with famous quotations of the star painted on the sides of the canvas, and other symbols, such as the artist’s signature are all hidden throughout.

Javier’s art is influenced by his cross-cultural upbringing having been raised in both Mexico & the U.S. Javier is both a First Generation American and a Native son of Mexico, a citizen of two cultures and of two nations. “Having the privilege to be from two lands has helped me be open to the world in general, this has always influenced & inspired my art weather it be painting, music or living my life.”

TICKET:

http://www.eventbrite.com/o/la-maison-dart-gallery-3525814135?s=45325878
results.how_to_find_us: 259 West 132nd Street, New York, NY, 10027 (Between ADC/FDB)
results.name: Opening Reception "Opulence Á La Maison d'Art" by Javier Ávila

results.description:
Hello! I have always wanted See the Legend- Now its time!
Due to high ticket demand, Stevie Wonder extended his Songs in the Key of Life North American 2015 tour in August by adding 20 additional North American dates scheduled from September 30 to November 24.
The demand remains high for the legendary R&B-soul singer, as tickets to see Stevie Wonder are averaging just under $200 on the secondary market, according to data provided by TiqIQ.

Stevie Wonder has extended his Songs in the Key of Life Performance Tour, adding 20 new North American dates scheduled from September 30th  to November 24th.

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book Spiritual Laws That Govern Humanity and the Universe by Lonnie C. Edwards, M.D.

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 2: The Continuum of Life and the World of Relationships. 

You can download the e-book FREE here!

About the Book

God has created laws by which the universe is governed. Humanity has continued to set these laws into creative motion through thoughts, prayers, motives, intentions, voices, and beliefs. These are the right tools. In this book the student will learn how to use them always for the good.

Human beings are responsible for creating the good, the beautiful, and the true- all of which we desire to experience. But humans are also responsible for creating that which we do not desire to experience. However, being co-creators with God, the quality of our thoughts, beliefs, and intentions will determine and manifest our world. There is work to do, and those who are on the path with knowledge of God’s attributes and God’s laws, and with love and good will in their hearts, will do that work. This is your guide to put these concepts into practice in our troubled world today!

All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Spiritual Laws: Continuum of Life

results.description:
Chett Rubenstein and Joshua Beach from InsightXM will join us to discuss data analytics for the events industry. The events industry creates a huge amount of data, including registration, marketing, event apps, booth scanning, RFID/BLE, 1:1 meetings and social media. The people putting on these events usually have neither the time nor the capability to do much with all this data, and the golden nuggets buried within go largely unmined. Chett and Joshua will discuss the challenges they faced, and how their UX process resulted in a pivot that fundamentally changed the way that users engage with their company.

Chett Rubenstein is the CTO and co-founder of InsightXM, where he brings over 35 years of experience creating scalable software solutions and a passion for both data and UX.

Joshua Beach directs Product Management and Product Marketing at InsightXM, where he leverages his background in design, mathematics and data analytics to create UX that turns the complex into the sublime.
results.name: InsightXM: The UX of Events Data

results.description:
Born and raised in the Tri-state area, Brendan (aka @rit) has been a member of the NYC Scala scene since we started back in 2009! He's worked at MongoDB, where he authored Casbah, a well-known Scala library for MongoDB, Typesafe, Netflix, and now he's brought his skills to Bold Radius. He's been an instructor and consultant for a long time, and given many many talks during his career, so this one is not to be missed.

What I've always liked most about Brendan is even as he's adventured into the more functional side of Scala, he's always maintained a practical outlook and not forgotten his Java roots. 

At this meetup, he'll be discussing Scala Macros. If you're not familiar with Scala Macros, they are an approach you can take to remove boilerplate from your code (typically in an API) by providing the compiler with instructions on what boiler plate to replace at compile time. Sounds tricky? It is, so we're lucky to have Brendan!

Special thanks to Goldman Sachs for providing the venue and food, and Bold Radius for both Brendan and its sponsorship!
results.how_to_find_us: The attendees will be directed to the main entrance on the corner of Vesey and West St (it's the one opposite WTC). We'll have name tags and folks coordinating there also.
results.name: @rit (aka Brendan McAdams) teaches us about Scala Macros!
