results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, October 7th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The October session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (September 30th - October 21st):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (September 30th - October 21st):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (September 29th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.
results.how_to_find_us: Take elevators to the 2nd Floor & make a left. We have the entire studio loft space, complete with brand new, clean rooms, hardwood floors, mirrors, 12’ ceiling, A/C, & sound system.

This month, real estate investor and owner of Steward Redevelopment & Recovery Michael Fernandes will be capturing everyone's attention!  Learn how he utilizes most leads typical investors push to the side such as homes with no equity and houses that are upside down.  He will also share with you how YOU can profit in his deals by providing him with these leads!

Michael Fernandes collaborates with a strong team of litigators to make sure homeowners in trouble do not lose their shirts.  His team works hand in hand with the homeowner in trouble, puts money in their pockets, fills the property with tenants in need, and helps relocate the homeowner... all while making money and increasing his rental property portfolio.  Come out to better understand this counter intuitive approach to real estate investing and be ready to be blown away!

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin 

Emily (also the MeetUp group organizer) is a writer, editor, and teacher. She has taught creative writing and mindfulness meditation at Columbia University, The Interdependence Project, Adelphi University, GreenspaceNYC, and Mission to (dit)Mars. Emily has been practicing mindfulness meditation for ten years, and trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR and a monthly contemplative writing workshop. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!
results.how_to_find_us: The church is located at 23-35 Broadway, between Crescent St. and 23rd St. It is on the north side of Broadway, just past Trade Fair and Synergy Fitness. There is an awning over the front door. The church shares the space with Art House Astoria.

For our October meetup we're continuing with our panel sessions featuring a developers' panel discussion. 

Come prepared with your questions and be ready for an all you ever wanted to know session on back end development and coding - our experts will discuss eCommerce platforms including Magento and Shopify. 

This month we'll have speakers Vipul Dadhich from ThoughtYard Labs and Steven Hoffman from Jomashop. 

The agenda for this event:

7:00 pm - Networking 

7:20 pm - 30 second elevator pitch of what you do or some thing you're working on

7:30 pm - Developers' Panel 

8:00 pm - will be Q&A followed by Networking 

Please message me directly if you're interested in presenting at this meet up, or any other meet ups in the future.

See you soon! 

This meetup is sponsored by Hara Partners

results.description:
To CJK Experts and Native Speakers:

We practice like this (including, but not limited to):

Session 1 (7pm-8pm): Interpretation methods practice

For example, words, phrases or sentences interpretation, target language repeating, shadowing and summarization, etc.

We set two tables to practice Chinese and Korean separately (Japanese is on hiatus due to low membership). The session is basically for intermediate & above Chinese and Korean learners.

Session 2 (8pm-9pm): Topic-based speaking practice

Summary, speak or discuss the topic you are provided or you have prepared by your target language (Chinese & Korean).

Also, everybody can move to any table as they want.

If you would like to practice English, please join our regular Saturday meetup generously hosted by Carl.

Looking forward to practicing with you all!

Organizers

results.description:
Come and join us for the next live stream event of The Product Mentor!  Sit back and listen or join with your own questions.

• Mentor: Addi Regev, Director of Product, Outbrain
• Topic: Mobile / Responsive / Adaptive - Just Optimized Decisions, Decisions, Decisions

RSVP to attend AND THEN at the start of this event visit http://TheProductMentor.com/live to join in!

Thanks & see you there!

About The Product Mentor

The Product Mentor is a program designed to pair Product Mentors and Mentees from around the World, across all industries, from start-up to enterprise, guided by the fundamental goals…

Better Decisions. Better Products. Better Product People.

Each Session of the program runs for 6 months with paired individuals…

• Conducting regular 1-on-1 mentor-mentee chats
• Sharing experiences with the larger Product community
• Participating in live-streamed product management lessons and Q&A

Signup to be a Mentor Today!

.

See you all next week and miss you guys already^^

results.description:
It's time for #EngagemeetupNYC!  

RSVP ON EVENTBRITE TO SAVE YOUR SPOT

To help brands engage, retain and monetize their mobile audience, Apptimize and Appboy are co-hosting a panel discussion focused on mobile acquisition and retention. During the event, attendees can enjoy pizza and beer while hearing real-life strategies and best practices from mobile experts, including:

• Nancy Hua – Founder + CEO, Apptimize

• Miles Lennon – Product Area Lead, Spotify

• Brian Donohue – CEO, Instapaper 

• Samantha John – Co-Founder + CTO, Hopscotch

• Dave Wisdom – Success, Appboy

Only a small number of apps reach their full potential. Take this opportunity to gain insight into long-term mobile success from industry thought leaders.

The Plan

7:00PM – Networking, Food and Drinks

7:30PM – Panel Discussion 

8:30PM – Q&A, Closing Remarks

Please be sure to RSVP on the Eventbrite page so we can save you a seat. Looking forward to the meetup!
results.name: SPOTIFY, INSTAPAPER + HOPSCOTCH join APPTIMIZE to discuss engagement & retention

results.description:
Tell Governor Cuomo: Veto Port Ambrose!

Wednesday, October 14, | 7:00 – 8:00 pm

Richard Rodgers Theater | 226 West 46th Street, Manhattan

Governor Cuomo is heading to Broadway -- and we're going to rally outside his event, urging him to veto the Port Ambrose LNG facility!

Port Ambrose is a liquefied natural gas port proposed for off our coast. It threatens our beaches and ocean ecology and would maintain our reliance on dirty fossil fuels.

Cuomo has the authority to stop this, so head on over after work on October 14th to call on him to protect the future of our oceans, beaches and waves by saying NO to Port Ambrose. There will be music and street performances to convey this important message!

Let LNG Rep Nikita know you are coming at [masked]

If you can't make the rally, sign the action alert and ask Gov. Cuomo to veto Port Ambrose http://go.surfrider.org/CuomoStopLNG
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the Surfrider Foundation Signs
results.name: Rally to tell Governor Cuomo: Veto Port Ambrose!

results.description:
EVERY Wednesday Night!

New York City's hottest open mic in the heart of Queens' cultural mecca and in the homiest underground spot around - one level downstairs in the Q4 Hotel in Long Island City.

Produced by the long-running independent performance series, The Inspired Word (http://inspiredwordnyc.com), which has featured Grammy winners, American Idol finalists, Golden Globe Award winners, Emmy nominated actors, and HBO Def Poetry stars, this open mic is open to ALL types of performing artists - musicians, comedians, poets, fiction/nonfiction writers, playwrights, spoken word artists, storytellers, performance artists, dancers, etc.

20 performance slots, 6-minute time limit for anything spoken, 7 minutes for anything musical. **Note to musicians: If you have backing tracks, bring them on an mp3 player or smartphone. Note to piano/keyboard players: You must bring your own keyboard.**

We are dedicated to celebrating the best of Queens' performing arts and developing a warm local artistic community. 

NO AGE RESTRICTIONS.

*****

When: Every Wednesday Night

Where: Q4 Hotel
http://www.q4hotel.com/

29-09 Queens Plaza N.
Long Island City, NYC

Time: 7pm sharp

Admission: $7 online for solo performer or audience member, $10 at the door

This is a very popular open mic. You can pay online or at the door, but we STRONGLY suggest you purchase a ticket in advance to guarantee a performance slot.

*****

By subway, take the E to Queens Plaza, N/Q/7 to Queensboro Plaza.

*****

Produced by Mike Geffner Presents The Inspired Word

http://inspiredwordnyc.com

"It's not just a series...It's a movement."

#SupportLiveArtsNYC
results.how_to_find_us: Go to front desk and ask where the downstairs stairwell is to the open mic.
results.name: Wednesday Night Open Mic @ Q4 Hotel - Music, Poetry, Comedy, Spoken Word

group.name: The Inspired Word NYC Open Mic - Poetry, Music, Comedy

results.description:
Mixer? Singer? Triangle player? Doesn't matter. Here's how it works:

At our first event, we'll be recording a bare bones version of a song right in Andres' home studio.

Then we'll upload our finished song. You go home and do your thang. Remix it. Cover it. Add to it. Reimagine it. Film something to it. Whatever. Let your imagination run wild.

At our second meetup, you bring it in and show it off. Tell us what you did and how you did it. Then, we pick another song and do it all again.

A great way to both learn more about home recording and keep your creative juices flowing. And of course, with as many as 12 versions of one song, definitely a spark for collaboration. Come give it a shot!
results.name: Remixathon/Show and Tell

group.name: NYC Logic Pro/Garageband DIY Music Production Meetup

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Tell Governor Cuomo: Veto Port Ambrose!
Wednesday, October 14,[masked]pm
https://www.facebook.com/events/1498662170448337/

Governor Cuomo is holding a fundraiser on Broadway -- and we're going to rally outside the event, urging him to veto the Port Ambrose LNG facility!
Port Ambrose is a liquefied natural gas port proposed for off our coast. The project threatens our health, safety, and environment.
Port Ambrose presents a public health threat, with explosive gas risking thousands of lives. It threatens our beaches, ocean ecology, and tourism & fishing industries. It would maintain our reliance on dirty fossil fuels while blocking a wind energy project proposed for the same location.
Fortunately, Cuomo has the authority to stop this dangerous proposal -- and on October 14, we're going to call on him to protect New Yorkers by doing so!
Sponsoring organizations (list information): Anti-LNG Coalition, Food & Water Watch, NYPIRG, Catskill Mountainkeeper, Sane Energy Project, United for Action, Green Education & Legal Fund, Clean Ocean Action, Surfrider Foundation (NYC Chapter), Citizen Action of New York, 350NYC, 350Brooklyn, Sierra Club Atlantic Chapter, Environmental Action
https://www.facebook.com/events/1498662170448337/

Contact:Eric Weltman, Food & Water Watch

results.description:
Enjoy getting over the hump of the week! Join NJYPers for drinks and food in Montclair at Just Jakes. Network with dozens of young professionals and have a drink with Gina, our marketing manager.

Event fee gives you a guaranteed good crowd to mix with in our reserved area, plus NJYP-only Drink and Food Specials:
$2 off selected pints & bottles until 8PM
1/2 price drinks (excl. top shelf) until 8PM
$8 pitchers of Miller Lite starting 8PM
$4 well drinks starting 8PM
$5 bombs
Food specials TBA

RSVP Here: http://www.njyp.org/events/over-the-hump-drinks-in-montclair

BUY Here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/over-the-hump-drinks-in-montclair-tickets-18772593332 (NJYP member discount is only for paid NJYP members www.njyp.org--you can join NJYP or choose the non-member cost)

Member Cost:
$3 online (NO Eventbrite Fee!)
$4 at the door

Non-Member Cost:
$5 online (plus $0.99)
$6 at the door

Who can attend:
Young professionals, single or married, who are 21-39 years of age. Expect people to walk up to you to introduce themselves and feel free to walk up to others who you do not know. Newbies are at EVERY NJYP event so if this is your first, you won't be alone.

Tickets:
All sales are final. A limited number of tickets will be sold. This event is rain or shine.

How to get there:
Just Jakes is in Montclair. The venue is <10 min walking from the train, and parking at meters is free starting at 7:00PM. See directions here: DIRECTIONS

How to find the group:
We will meet in a private area--there will be signs.

RSVP Here: http://www.njyp.org/events/over-the-hump-drinks-in-montclair

results.description: Come to our purely positive séance where we encourage mystics, psychics, mediums and all people to enhance their spiritual awareness in a safe and empowering environment. All of our séance conductors are highly trained and renowned mediums. Whether you are looking to connect with a loved one who has recently passed or to receive messages from spirit, our group offers a warm and friendly environment to all who are interested. Before each séance we begin our group with a 15 minute lesson on psychic development, covering topics from psychic impressions to spirit communication. We then begin our séance with a nondenominational prayer of protection and lead a guided visual mediation. After the meditation each person who attends will receive a message from one of our highly trained séance conductors. All participants are guaranteed to receive a message. Our group meets for approximately 2 hours. The purpose of our séance is to communicate directly with spirit and to form an open and inviting spiritual community in New York City Our meeting times are every other Wednesday Night at 7:00pm and our fee is $20. Please be timely, because we do not open our doors once we begin our meditation (for obvious reasons :). For legal purposes it is understood that our group and the messages given at our séances are for entertainment purposes only.

results.description:
Join the New York City Developer User Group at Silverline CRM on Weds, Oct 14th at 7 PM to explore Copado, the ultimate native Planning, Deployment and Integration tool for the Force.com Platform.

Federico Larsen, co-founder and architect at Copado Solutions will show us the many features of Copado Deployer and explain the underlying technologies and APIs that provide so much power to developers and admins for managing changes in Salesforce Orgs. Copado brings together 4 platform APIs to link your Salesforce Orgs (and Github repos too!) and provide you an end-to-end utility for planning and getting code and components deployed fast and accurately.

You can install Copado from the AppExchange in either a new DE Org or an existing Org (safe enough for Production even!) and then provide your Org ID on this form to get 10,000 free credits.


As always, our Meetup is hosted and co-sponsored by Silverline and food and drink will be provided. So bring your appetites, your laptops (if you want to get hands-on!), your colleagues and your questions!

What is Copado


Copado is the next generation cloud based change and release management solution that delivers quicker deployments; better visibility and traceability of your Salesforce orgs and allows you to manage errors proactively.
Copado has taken away the pain from Deployments, Release Management and Continuous Integration.
Copado is designed to overcome the challenges of the metadata-api, allowing any user to deploy profiles and permission sets easily, among hundreads of features specifically designed to increase productivity.

About Copado
Copado was founded in 2013 in Madrid by two Salesforce Technical Architects. Both founders, Federico and Philipp have been working in the Salesforce ecosystem since 2005. After facing themselves the pain of managing large implementations they decided to do something about it. Copado is the leading deployment tool and is #3 revenue generating ISV partner in EMEA (as of August 2015).
results.name: Salesforce Developer Tool Deep-Dive: Copado

group.name: New York City Salesforce Developer Group

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description:
The protection of Intellectual Property rights is a vital element in successful business development. Business owners spend lots of time, money and efforts on developing their ventures, earning the loyalty of the customers, branding, marketing campaigns and many other aspects of their businesses. In a startup world intellectual property is often a determinant of the company’s value. 

If IP ownership rights are not properly secured their owners may either be unable to take full advantage of their work products or loose them completely. During this meet-up we will review each form of Intellectual Property, its use and degrees of protection each of them provides.

I. Types of Intellectual Property we will discuss: 

a. Copyrights
b. Trademarks (or Service Marks)
c. Patents
d. Trade Secrets
results.name: Intellectual Property for Business Owners

results.description:
Glenfiddich is one those scotches you can find at most bars, no matter whether they specialize in whisky or not.  It's also my go to scotch when I'm at JFK!  I've never really had anything other than the 12, so I'm interested to see what else they offer.  Glenfiddich is a speyside scotch located in the town, Dufftown, and is gaelic for "valley of the deer." The distillery has been family owned and run for 5 generations and many of their whiskies have won numerous awards.  This event is at the frequented WBEU bar, the Copper Still.  Here is a link to the bars whiskey event site as they usually have events on Whiskey Wednesdays and I don't have time to post/attend them all!

http://www.thecopperstillnyc.com/whiskey-tastings/

The logistics: I will get there around 7 and the complimentary tasting begins at 8pm.  The closest subway stops are the Astor Place 6, 1st or 3rd ave L, and the 8th St. NR.  

**I'm not sure which scotches will be sampled, this is just a pic**

results.description: Welcome to our bi-weekly meeting! You may know us as Brooklyn for Bernie or Team Bernie NY. The Bronx, Queens, Manhattan, Staten Island - please join us in Brooklyn for this important look at where our work lies in the coming months as we move past the October 9th deadline. results.description:
Please join Jersey City Writers and Art House Productions for a literary event featuring a night of mystery, intrigue, and murder.

Noir: A Celebration of Detective Fiction will feature work by local writers. This literary event will also feature a talk by two authors -- S.A. Solomon and S.J. Rozan. Solomon has published crime fiction and poetry in New Jersey Noir (Akashic Books), Grand Central Noir (Metropolitan Crime), and the 5-2 Crime Poetry Weekly, and she is a regional board member for the Mystery Writers of America, New York chapter. Solomon is currently working on a noir series set in Newark and Jersey City. SJ Rozan is the author of twelve novels. Her work has won the Edgar, Shamus, Anthony, Nero, and Macavity awards for Best Novel and the Edgar for Best Short Story. Rozan has served on the National Boards of Mystery Writers of America and Sisters in Crime, and is ex-President of the Private Eye Writers of America. The following stories have been selected for Noir:
- Notes in the Dark City by Meg Merriet
- The Beginning by S. Nick Stone
- The Lost Dream by Vincent D'Onofrio
- Just in Case by Beth Bentley
- Scarlet by Joseph Braccino
- Noir Farm by Stephen Weber
- Double Take by Jim DeAngelis
- The Case of the Man on the Wrong Damn Side by Paul M Bauer

Tickets will be $10 at the door. Lite refreshments will be served.
results.name: Noir: A Celebration of Detective Fiction

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Rage of Demons

results.description:
Hey all! I'm Chip. You'll see me helping Lady Morgana & co with logistical details and online planning.

In case you weren't aware, Hekate's Sacred Temple has some exciting plans for the future. Our end goal is to purchase a brick-and-mortar space to host a physical, permanent temple dedicated to Hekate: a lasting space to honor the Goddess in the modern world and a base of operations to do Her work. There's a long series of steps that we need to take before we get there, and now, we're entering the first stage: applying for 501(c)(3) status to be officially recognized as a non-profit religious organization. Step 1: Raise money for the 501(c)(3) application fee. Here's where you come in!

If you like cheap and delicious food (especially waffle fries), meeting and chatting with like-minded Witches / Pagans / followers of the Goddess, and helping make the dream of a physical temple a reality, come to our Fundraiser Planning Meeting! We're meeting at the Monarch Diner in Wayne, NJ next Wednesday, October 14th. We'll get to know each other over milkshakes, cheese fries, and the other glories of NJ diners, with the goal of planning a fundraiser for the 501(c)(3) fee that we can implement immediately. We want to raise the money in time to meet the January application deadline, so let's make this happen!

All comers welcome! If you can't make the meeting but you want to contribute ideas, message me. If this is your first time joining one of our Meetups and you're nervous, don't be! We are all here to do Her work. Delicious diner food is just an added bonus.

Hope to see you there!
results.name: Fundraiser Planning Meeting

group.name: NJ COMMUNITY OF PAGANS, WITCHES, & TORCHBEARERS OF HEKATE

results.description:
Join us for Summer Tennis.

Check in at Clubhouse for court assignment upon arrival, then play under the lights 'til 10:00pm at this beautiful wooded park*.

Please remember to check in with the clubhouse to reserve a court. Players need to reserve a court with at least one other player present and should be a Hudson County resident with ID.

Mention to the court staff that you are with the Meetup group and ask that they keep us together if possible (3 courts).

Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game. And remember to bring plenty of water!

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending. I will provide my cell # for RSVP's so we can find each other. Please also bear in mind that we are usually on more than one court - they are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. You should locate other players and grab a court when you arrive.

Although we won't enforce attendance, please keep your rsvp updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!

*Free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as a guest of the resident players to avoid a possible $10 fee to play.
results.how_to_find_us: Be sure to check the rsvp list for other player's photos. I will send my contact info before the event.

results.description:
Come join us for a cozy night of music at Branded Saloon and hear some awesome local women artists! And enter are free raffle to win CDs, t-shirts, and more! As always, house band DK & the Joy Machine warms things up with smart and quirky alt-folk and acoustic punk on Mountain dulcimer. Lianne Smith sings grown-up songs about architecture, thieves, bicycles, the end of summer, and two roads that diverge in a wood. Ember Schrag--accompanied by guitar and band--closes out the night with her Great-Plains-gothic style, writing about land and space and hope and despair. This music will make your heart sing and your eyes fill up with stars!

$8 ADMISSION + one drink minimum
*No one turned away and show your love to the artists! *

Thanks to the woman-owned FUNKADELIC STUDIOS for being our sponsors!

Show starts 7pm SHARP... wraps up by 10pm
Come early to get a seat and something yummy to eat! * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
Line up- plus special surprise guests...! DK & THE JOY MACHINE
DK&theJoyMachine's album, SHY ONE, has been described as "...very intense, colorful and diverse ... a novel of sorts. Dark, light, humorous & humble. " Her "quirky and smart" songs celebrate all the crucial things in life: unrequited love, falling in love with feral cats, and treating yourself with kindness. Known for her sultry, expressive voice, well crafted songs, and genre-blending, innovative work on mountain dulcimer---plucking, strumming, bowing and “rocking out” on this trad instrument, “DK”'s music is at turns evocative, moving and playful and fun.
www.dkandtheJoymachine.com
https://www.facebook.com/dkANDtheJoyMachine
https://www.reverbnation.com/dknthejoymachine

LIANNE SMITH
Lianne Smith writes songs about standing in the middle of the road and wondering which way to go, about how others cheat us and how we cheat ourselves, about free-wheeling, bicycle riding, look-ma-no-hands exhilarations, and how it feels to say goodbye to summer.
liannesmith.bandcamp.com

EMBER SCHRAG
Ember Schrag is a singer and guitarist from western Nebraska. Hailed as "distinctive and free of affect or artifice" by the A.V. Club, her Great-Plains-gothic style "lands somewhere between Scout Niblett and Karen Dalton, writing about land and space and hope and despair" (Nightlight). Schrag now lives in New York and is hard at work on her third record. Her current band includes guitarist Bob Bannister, bassist Debby Schwartz, and Schrag's longtime collaborator, Gary Foster, on drums, with occasional guests Susan Alcorn (pedal steel) and Concetta Abbate (violin).
http://www.emberschrag.com/

RSVP and like us here to keep in touch and support queer/women artists! https://www.facebook.com/events/723307587798109/
results.name: Fabulous October Songbird Series- with Lianne Smith and Ember Schragg

results.description:
Explore electronics, coding, and creative technology at our monthly Micro-controller night. We talk about Arduinos, Raspberry Pis, and the other tiny devices we love to use for embedded projects. A laptop with a usb port is recommended in case you want to get hands on with any of the devices.

This event is free for everyone. Please bring a computer with a USB port, ideally bring one or more micro-controllers that you want to work with, or at least a project idea. Please share your ideas in the comments below to inspire others.

Boards are available online, or PM the organizer and they can either get one for you or tell you where they're cheapest online.

MakerBar volunteers will be present to help you with your electronics project or work on their own.

You're welcome to come hack on whatever you'd like, even if it's totally unrelated to electronics entirely. There will be plenty of awesome hackers from our community for you to meet.

The Microcontroller Special Interest Group runs on the second Wednesday every month.


[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

results.description:
The protection of Intellectual Property rights is a vital element in successful business development. Business owners spend lots of time, money and efforts on developing their ventures, earning the loyalty of the customers, branding, marketing campaigns and many other aspects of their businesses. In a startup world intellectual property is often a determinant of the company’s value. If IP ownership rights are not properly secured their owners may either be unable to take full advantage of their work products or loose them completely. During this meet-up we will review each form of Intellectual Property, its use and degrees of protection each of them provides.

I. Types of Intellectual Property we will discuss: a. Copyrights
b. Trademarks (or Service Marks)
c. Patents
d. Trade Secrets
results.name: Intellectual Property for Business Owners Seminar

results.description:
Join Marcos Salazar, Co-founder and Executive Director of Be Social Change, on Wednesday, October 14th for Intro to Social Entrepreneurship: Opportunities, Challenges and Trends.

===========================================

This is a paid class - be sure to purchase your ticket here: bit.ly/BSCSocEntOct14

=========================================== 

Social entrepreneurship is a rapidly evolving field that leverages entrepreneurship principles towards solving social and environmental problems. It represents a new lens through which individuals and organizations around the world are creating meaningful and sustainable change. The term itself has attracted an increasing amount of talent, resources, and attention, however, social entrepreneurship is at the beginning stages of its growth and is often misunderstood.

This Be Social Change class draws upon the latest social entrepreneurship research as well as the insights and lessons learned from Marcos building out the Be Social Change community to help define and clarify what social entrepreneurship means, how it is practiced, and what you can do to participate within this movement. The class will illuminate how a generation of change makers is exploring and developing new approaches and business models to address the world’s most critical challenges.

* Doors open at 6:45, class starts at 7:00 sharp *

WHAT YOU'LL LEARN

• An overall understanding of the social entrepreneurship ecosystem

• The difference between entrepreneurship vs. social entrepreneurship

• New types of organizations and business models used to create social change

• Opportunities and challenges for the future of social entrepreneurship

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• Anyone who wants to learn more about the latest in social entrepreneurship and how it is being used to create social change around the world

• You have an idea for a project, organization or business and want to learn how other change makers have brought their ideas to life

• You want to become part of a community using entrepreneurship as a vehicle for creating bold, innovative social impact


INSTRUCTOR BIO

Marcos Salazar (@marcossalazar) is a social entrepreneur, career + life coach, consultant, speaker, and community builder. His passion is working with professionals, entrepreneurs, and creatives to help them pursue work they are passionate about, build authentic personal brands, become financially successful, and create lives that make the world a better place. He does this through 1-on-1 coaching, nonprofit and businesses consulting, and on a larger scale as Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change where he’s built the largest social impact community and professional development hub in New York City. Marcos earned a B.A. in Psychology from Amherst College as well as a Masters in Organizational Management and an Executive Leadership Coaching certificate from The George Washington University. Marcos is a board member of the Young Professionals Nonprofit Network and an American Express Leadership Academy Fellow. You can learn more about him at www.MarcosSalazar.com.   

SPACE PARTNER 


https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/uJVwfvixplYpd-1-nxDuepX3vBOInAufXV6MNi_cNM9zgEZKbt85kXyc7PBdJcS88Vj2g96PgAs-wjZgpX52tbBM9EPxXfGo8wVyn2J-lWZyPNCil_Y918oSBpdsYMX0BVbPGxQ

</a>

The host of this month BSC's Class is <a href="https://www.wework.com/locations/new-york-city/dumbo-heights?utm_source=BeSocialChange&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=2015-09-NY-BKN03-3p-CM">WeWork, the platform for creators. They provide the space, community and services you need to make a life, not just a living. With beautiful workspaces and offices, weekly events, support, and access to 30,000+ members around the world, WeWork is the place to grow your business in 2015 and beyond.

Experience the space and benefits WeWork has to offer for yourself. To take advantage of a free trial day at WeWork Dumbo Heights email [masked] and mention you attended a BSC Class.

If you are healthy, you can see better, you can eat better, you can speak better, you can hear better and you can run better. All this depends on just one thing. Similarly that which enriches your spirit is so essential to enrich all other aspects of life.” -Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder, Art of Living Foundation

Whatever we do in life, it is all directed towards being happy. Why do we even do some service to somebody? It is because it gives some happiness to us. So anything we do in our life is directed towards achieving happiness, greater happiness, and even greater happiness. That’s how the mind goes. Yet, are we happy? Yes, some times. But often not!

This free seminar examines what comes in the way of our happiness. There will be a discussion on tools that can lead us to happiness – tools that every human being is privileged to learn and use. Come, relax, refresh and smile.

The Place: Two former Per Se cooks are behind this subterranean restaurant in Nolita that serves up home-style Thai food. Uncle Boons recently received its first Michelin star and the prices are very reasonable. I am imagining this place will be similar to Pok Pok but without the trip to Brooklyn.


Menu: http://www.uncleboons.com/menu-dinner-2/

Eater Article: http://ny.eater.com/2015/4/28/8502003/uncle-boons-restaurant-review

NY Times Review: http://www.nytimes.com/2013/07/03/dining/reviews/restaurant-review-uncle-boons-in-nolita.html

As always:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

In the winter of 1919, a young mother named Mathilda Neumann drowns beneath the ice of a rural Wisconsin lake. The shock of her death dramatically changes the lives of her daughter, troubled sister, and husband. . . . Told in the voices of several of the main characters and skipping back and forth in time, the narrative gradually and tantalizingly reveals the dark family secrets and the unsettling discoveries that lead to the truth of what actually happened the night of the drowning. . . . results.description:
An introduction to meditation - free 

The rest in meditation is deeper than the deepest sleep that you can ever have. When the mind becomes free from agitation, is calm and serene and at peace, meditation happens.

The benefits of meditation are manifold. It is an essential practice for mental hygiene. A calm mind, good concentration, clarity of perception, improvement in communication, blossoming of skills and talents, an unshakeable inner strength, healing, the ability to connect to an inner source of energy, relaxation, rejuvenation, and good luck are all natural results of meditating regularly.

In today's world where stress catches on faster than the eye can see or the mind can perceive, meditation is no more a luxury. It is a necessity. To be unconditionally happy and to have peace of mind, we need to tap into the power of meditation.

Some experiences

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

This group is dedicated exclusively to novels. Please read the Novel Group Intro and FAQ before attending. Be prepared to read back through previous chapters of a novel-in-progress before committing to this group. Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Friday, eleven days prior to the Meetup. On that day, I'll send out an email listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order, with a link to the Google Drive folder where the stories live. That list will also appear under Discussions and will be edited as changes occur.

To submit, Email your submission to [masked]

SUBJECT: The Title of the group you're submitting to and your name. EXAMPLE: Cam's Novel Group December 8th, Spidercam

MESSAGE: Name, Title, Word Count, any additional info. EXAMPLE: Spidercam, Glory Chapter 2, 7,000 words. This is a rewrite.

Send to [masked]

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!

results.description:
Experience a Spiritual Tool
That Can Help Transform Your Life!

 

No matter what your spiritual background or faith, you are invited to learn a simple technique that can help transform your life. Join us and others in your community to experience spiritual insights gained by singing HU—a love song to God.

Singing HU can:
• Expand your awareness
• Help you release mental and emotional stresses
• Heal a broken heart
• Offer solace during times of grief
• Help you experience divine love


We sing HU together for about 20 minutes followed by five minutes of quiet contemplation. Light refreshment and conversation follow. Please join us—your friends and family are invited, too. We hope to see you there.

Every Second Wednesday,  7:30 – 8:30 pm

ECKANKAR Center
11 Park Street, Montclair, NJ
There is on-street parking and two municipal parking lots in the area. Please pay particular attention to meters and parking signs. (Metered parking is free evenings after 7pm and on Sundays.)


For more information about HU check out www.HearHU.org and MiraclesinYourLife.org. For information on other events being held throughout the state, visit www.eckankar-nj.org.

 

Presented by the Satsang Society of New Jersey, Inc., a Chartered Affiliate of ECKANKAR, Religion of the Light and Sound of God and hosted by the Center for Spiritual Living North Jersey.

The terms ECKANKAR, ECK, EK, MAHANTA, SOUL TRAVEL and VAIRAGI, among others are trademarks of ECKANKAR. Copyright ©2012 ECKANKAR. All rights reserved. ECKANKAR PO Box 2000, Chanhassen, MN[masked] USA. Visit Eckankar’s Web site at www.eckankar.org.

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $9. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

aAt the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON NYC

results.description:
Having trouble fully absorbing A Course in Miracles (ACIM) or another non-dualistic spiritual tradition? Then A COURSE OF LOVE may be just for you! Channeled by the same voice that authored ACIM but in more easy to understand and feminine language, Mari Perron’s A Course of Love speaks to the heart rather than the mind. Let’s explore this important new text together and use it as a springboard to become peaceful miracle workers. Led by CRS co-founders and ACIM Teachers/Healers Yasuko Kasaki and Christopher Pelham, this class work its way through the text week by week. 

We're just starting (fall 2015) but you can join in later any time. Like yoga, it's really more experiential than progressive learning. This week we'll be covering chapter 2!

You can easily order the book online from Amazon or BN.com, and e-book versions are available.

It may be astonishing to hear that there is a “continuation” of A Course in Miracles, but it is true. Forty years ago Jesus dictated ACIM to the scribe Helen Schucman. More recently, over three years, he similarly dictated A Course of Love. Jesus himself referred to what he was dictating as a “continuation of A Course in Miracles.” Students of ACIM will recognize the Voice. Students of truth, whatever their background, will find that ACOL resonates with the heart.

A Course of Love builds upon the same non-dualistic thought system as ACIM, yet it is a course for the heart. ACOL and ACIM work hand-in-hand. Yet remarkably, ACOL bypasses the mind. It uses thought to go beyond thought. Those yearning to access the heart’s knowing will find help here. This is your invitation to live the purposeful, meaningful life of the new—the reality of heaven on earth.

Wednesday nights from 8 – 9:30 pm at CRS
Classes are $20 and class cards are available.
results.how_to_find_us: above Think Coffee shop (look for the brown door and ring the bottom buzzer)
results.name: Intro to A Course of Love (channeled by Mari Perron)

results.description:
Jesse is making a pair of 5.8Ghz Clover Leaf Antennas for his quadcopter FPV video system.

He also plans (at some point) to make a 5.8Ghz SWR meter so he can test and tune these antennas for the minimum reflection back down the transmission cable. I'm told that this (SWR) project should be pretty doable.

At the last meeting, there was a bit of a delay as we watched a Disaster Response Operations Center support kit being assembled and tested  before we got down to business.

James gave a great TinkerCAD presentation and he showed us a few laser-cut parts from his custom made 3D printer. I had no idea a web based CAD system could be done so well.

I was also surprised that we didn't have more interest in buying a Glow Forge laser printer.

Then (late in the evening) there was some progress on the process of incorporation.
results.name: Make 5.8Ghz Clover Leaf Antennas

New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street


East Coast Swing/Jitterbug with  Spencer Weisbond

This six week, progressive session:
Sept 30, 2015- Nov 4, 2015
Wed
8:30PM - 9:30PM

  101: Beginner   Learn cool moves to classic tunes! This progressive, basic swing dance class will teach the absolute beginner how to Jitterbug or what is now known as East Coast Swing. For young adults and above, this partner dance class will teach beginner moves in swing and the technique to execute them properly. The class will learn a routine over a six week period. No partner, experience, or TALENT required.

    

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]

  Register and pricing below:

  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=634125407<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=625347764"></a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3300 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a>

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 


 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after ,,,, not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

+++

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

Don't be late , we start on time : )
results.name: Mt. Beacon ~ Fire Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE ~

results.description:

results.description:
Come and have a great time enjoy a great workout with great people while potentially  getting a fantastic sunrise! :)  Check out the photos of prior sunrise hikes !!

Please adhere to the two golden rules!

 1) Hike Safe

2) Have Fun  :)

Directions From NY Route 9D, look for Bob's Corner Store in Beacon. Turn east onto Howland Avenue. then immediately turn right into the parking area for Scenic Hudson's Mount Beacon Park.


Public Transportation: Metro-North Hudson Line to Beacon station -- walk uphill to trailhead

Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding lookout point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson River and surrounding area.

Distance: 4 miles round trip


The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain. Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit. On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).


You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.


If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group


We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Auto Mechanic

• Cleaning Service

• Florist

• Handyman or women

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!

venue.name: New York Society for Ethical Culture

results.description:
When Nuclear Plants Close
Challenges for U.S. Reactor Decommissioning

New York Society for Ethical Culture
10 AM – 3 PM, Thursday, October 15th, 2015

In the next decades most of the currently-operating U.S. nuclear power reactors are anticipated to close for aging, safety and economic reasons. This trend has already
begun with San Onofre Nuclear Generating Stations in Southern California, Kewaunee in Wisconsin, Vermont Yankee in Vermont, and Crystal River in Florida. Decommissioning more than one hundred nuclear reactors will bring serious challenges for state governments and impacted communities.
Among those challenges: limited experience with reactor decommissioning in the United States; lack of consensus between the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC), reactor operators, States, and the public on adequate
protection from residual radiation; absence of a geologic repositories to receive spent nuclear fuel; and insufficient funds set aside for decommissioning.

The Natural Resources Defense Council (NRDC), Hudson River Sloop Clearwater, and the New York Society for Ethical Culture seek to raise awareness of the significant public health, environmental, societal and financial challenge of decommissioning, now and in the coming decades, and identify sound and just CONFERENCE AGENDA
Welcome and Introductions 10 am - 10:30 am
 Welcome from NY Society for Ethical Culture
 Katherine Kennedy – Director, NRDC Energy & Transportation Program

Panel I: National Perspectives on Decommissioning 10:30 am -12 pm
 Mycle Schneider – Independent Consultant, Paris. Presentation:
The Prospects for U.S. Nuclear Retirements in the International Context
 Gregory Jaczko – Former Chairman, U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission:
Challenges Inherent in Sustainable, Durable Progress on Reactor Decommissioning
 David Lochbaum – Union of Concerned Scientists:
Technical and Regulatory Concerns for Decommissioning
 Peter Bradford – Former NRC Commissioner, and Former Maine & New York
Public Utility Commissioner: State and Federal Roles in Decommissioning Policy: What They Are and What They Could Be
 Geoffrey Fettus, NRDC Senior Attorney: Panel Moderator

Catered Lunch Break 12 pm – 1 pm

Panel II: State and Local Decommissioning Issues:

A focus on New York 1 pm -2:30 pm
 John Sipos – Assistant Attorney General, New York Attorney General’s Office:
Challenges In New York from the Indian Point and Other Reactors
 Deborah Katz – Executive Director, Citizen’s Awareness Network:
Deregulation of Decommissioning
 Tim Judson – Director, Nuclear Information & Resource Service: Decommissioning
Risks and Opportunities for States and Local Communities
 Paul Gallay – President, Hudson Riverkeeper: Perspectives on Indian Point
 Manna Jo Greene – Environmental Director, Hudson River Sloop Clearwater:

Open Discussion 2:30 pm – 3 pm

 Geoff Fettus and Manna Jo Greene: Discussion Moderators
 Matthew McKinzie – Director, NRDC Nuclear Program: Concluding Remarks

This conference was made possible by the generous support of The Jack and Belle Alpern Foundation
results.name: When Nuclear Plants Close: Challenges for U.S. Reactor Decommissioning

results.description:
Melanie Szlucha, a career coach and president of REDINC,LLC, will discuss how to effectively tackle the job search process, with strategies to stack the odds in your favor.
* Is your resume working for you? Learn how to better convey your value and fix ‘the
broken resume.’
* Do you want to end sweaty palms and awkward answers in an interview? Learn the
TODAY method as a way for you to prepare to ACE the interview.
* How effective is your networking? Remember, networking is not about how many business cards you can collect. Learn to take the work out of networking and make meaningful connections. Learn how to take advantage of the hidden, often overlooked casual, daily networking opportunities.

Join us to learn from our dynamic presenter, who will guide you through some of the most vital aspects of your job search, in a new and fresh approach, geared to make you a viable and desirable job candidate!

results.description:
6 times a year the State of New York invites us seniors to a lunch social at "Riverbank" with a live band and dancing. Coffee and tea are provided but you have to bring your own lunch. I love the dancing venue because you do not need a partner. Everyone just gets up on the floor and dances when the mood hits them. The band caters to us seniors by playing the songs we remember and love. I really enjoy watching the seniors dance. I also really enjoy the bands music. They always have one of New York's finest groups. The band will make you want to get up out of your seat and move around.

 The Social this October 15 will feature Salsa Music as played by Orlando Marin.  If you don't dance well to Salsa we will show you some salsa steps.   If you love Salsa....get out on the floor and do your thing.

April Newman

Hello everyone planning to be at Riverbank State Park. Don't forget the # 11 and the # 19 bus bring you right to the door. You know it is always a trek getting down to the Hudson River. Once you get to 145th street, you can walk on down, grab the bus, or hail a cab for the approximate 3 blocks.
I can not reserve a table with only 3 or 4 people attending so ... facing the stage, look for me at the tables on the left hand side. If this won't work because of other reservations, I will sit on the left hand side of the middle bleacher chairs. I will wear my new ORANGE HEAD BAND with the orange ribbons and orange flower. If I am not in a seat, look for me getting down on the dance floor. See you there
results.name: Riverbank State Park Senior Lunch Social.

If you are trying to build a startup with little to no technical skills, then join us on this free "How To Build A Startup As A Non-Tech Founder" webinar. 

On this webinar, we will teach non-technical founders how to start growing their basic technical skills, and outline several technologies, methods, and tools that you can use to start building a basic product on your own. In addition, we will discuss what you should and should not build on your own, and outline strategies for how to find developers and a technical co-founder.

results.description:
Join us for a full day and evening of social Wikipedia editing at the Guggenheim (drop-in any time, noon-8pm!), during which we will create, update, and improve Wikipedia articles covering the lives and works of women in architecture.

In conjunction with Archtober and New York Archives Week, the Guggenheim will host its third Wikipedia edit-a-thon—or, #guggathon— to enhance articles related to women in architecture on Wikipedia. The Guggenheim aims to further the goals of Ada Lovelace Day for STEM, and Art+Feminism for art, in a field that, by its nature combines both.

The Guggenheim will work alongside ArchiteXX, the founders of WikiD: Women Wikipedia Design #wikiD, the international education and advocacy program working to increase the number of Wikipedia articles on women in architecture and the built environment. New and experienced editors are welcome.

The event will include a training session for participants who are new to Wikipedia and Wikipedia specialists will be on hand to provide basic instruction and editing support.


Can’t join us in New York? Visit our global partnerships page to discover an edit-a-thon in a city near you or simply join remotely.

Page on Guggenheim:

http://www.guggenheim.org/new-york/calendar-and-events/2015/10/15/wikipedia-edit-a-thon-women-in-architecture/5228


Page on Wikipedia:


</a><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Meetup/WikiArte/MoMA_2015">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Meetup/NYC/Women_in_Architecture
results.name: Women in Architecture @ Guggenheim

results.description:
Join Daniel Norton for an intensive 90 minute lecture covering everything you wanted to know about lighting but were afraid to ask.


Starting with a brief description of all the major constant and strobe lighting options available to you and ending with a hands-on demonstration that will get you started in portrait and product photography (or video). This is both a great primer for those new to lighting and a refresher for those who have some experience in the field.  

We will walk through the various types of continuous lights for both filmmakers and still shooters including Tungsten, LED, Fluorescent and show brands in all price points, as well as talk about the pros and cons of flash for still photographers and studio versus small flash set-ups.

Everything you wanted to know about photographic lighting, broken down in a simple overview, complete with examples and live demos.  

LEARN: What type of lights will give you the most bang for your buck

LEARN: When to use different types of lights and how to mix them

LEARN: What is the difference between an umbrella and a softbox, or beauty dish?

LEARN: What is sync speed and flash duration?

LEARN: Five must-have pieces of grip


Demos Start at 12, 2 and 4:30pm.

The same information is covered in each session.

Daniel Norton is a Photographer, Director and DP with over 15 years experience in the advertising and editorial markets. As Director of Content Production and Events for Adorama Pro, Daniel can help you with any questions you might have about lighting, studio and production. Daniel also produces and hosts FREE weekly in-store trainings every Thursday as well as the Adorama TV series On Set with Daniel Norton.
results.name: Free Demo: ONSET- 90 Minute Lighting School

Comic time! Reading the IDW My Little Pony comic book series aloud together is a lot of fun. Come try it with us! 


This week:  Wrestling, and Festivals

So pack your books and come over to this week's meetup for Friendship is Magic #29 - 31 -  (descriptions and download links below)

http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/mlp/images/a/a9/Comic_issue_29_cover_A.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141217062913

http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/mlp/images/5/58/Comic_issue_30_cover_A.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150218052330

Friendship is Magic #29

The mane six travel to Manehattan to see a wrestling match, and they run into Cheerilee of all ponies.  Who is debating on going to meet one of the wrestlers, who is her long lost sister.  But will her sister want to meet her ? 

Written by:Ted Anderson


Artwork by: Jay Fosgitt

Download link: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic #29

Friendship is Magic #30
Ponyville is about to hold its annual Ponyville Days festival, commemorating the town's founding. However, Twilight Sparkle, the pony of ceremonies, has royal duties in Canterlot. Before she and Spike board the train, she ensures her friends that Mayor Mare will take care of the festival planning. Will the festival go without a hitch ?


Written by: Christina Rice
Artwork by:  Agnes Garbowska, Lauren Perry

Download link: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic #30

Friendship is Magic #31


With Ponyville split into two arguing sides and hundreds of ponies about to arrive to celebrate Ponyville Days, Twilight struggles to find a solution. Fluttershy suggests appealing to the ponies individually and convincing them to pitch in on their own. Will they be able to fix everything ?

Written by: Christina Rice
Artwork by: Agnes Garbowska, Lauren Perry

Download link:My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic #31
