results.description:
Please join us for a peaceful demonstration at New York Blood Center’s headquarters in New York City to urge NYBC to immediately reinstate funding for the care of over 60 chimpanzees they abandoned. NYBC promised to care for these animals for their lifetime. Come lend your voice and tell NYBC to keep that promise.

We will meet at St. Catherine's Park at 4pm (near entrance on northwest corner of E .67 St and 1st Ave) and then at 4:15pm we will walk as a group one half block to the NY Blood Center located at 310 E 67 St.

Earlier this year, the New York Blood Center abandoned more than 60 chimpanzees in Liberia, Africa after capturing them from the wild and exploiting them for decades in research. After NYBC pulled all funding for their care, The Humane Society of the United States and a coalition of 37 other organizations stepped in to provide emergency support for the chimpanzees. Despite massive public outcry and several attempts by the HSUS-led coalition to contact NYBC, the center continues to deny responsibility for the chimpanzees. NYBC must keep its promise and be a part of the long-term solution to provide these chimpanzees with humane, lifetime care.

Event will take place rain or shine!
results.how_to_find_us: St. Catherine's Park; Corner of 1st Ave and E 67th St.
results.name: HSUS: New York Blood Center Keep Your Promise

To engage the community in a moment of meaningful human connection.

results.description:
The Annual Pregnancy and infant Loss Awareness Walk in NYC

https://youtu.be/IJpU7ELIz1A

Thank you for your interest in NYC's annual walk to support Pregnancy and Infant Loss. Registration is $25 per person. Discounts available for teams of 5 or more people. Email for team information. All participants must register below. Walk for your child or walk in honor of a child loss. Homemade signs encouraged. Get your walking shoes and let's make Baby Steps towards change!

Register HERE http://www.knotmybaby.com/#!baby-steps-walk/c1sq8 In 1988, President Ronald Regean named October, Pregnancy and Infant Loss Awareness Month. In 2006, October 15th was named Pregnancy and Infant Loss Remembrance Day. At 7pm in every time zone on October 15th, surviving families across the world light a candle in remembrance of the litte ones they've lost. Knot My Baby will follow suit by having a walk over the Brooklyn Bridge and a candle lighting to conclude the ceremony. Arrive at the Park Row Subway Plaza entrance of City Hall Park in Manhattan, NY at 5:00pm on Thursday, October 15th, 2015 to complete registration. General park address in 31 Chambers Street, Ny, NY 10007. Visit www.NYCGovParks.org/parks/city-hall-park to familiarize yourself with the actual entrance we will be meeting at. We will promptly start our walk over the Brooklyn Bridge at 6:00pm and end at McLaughlin Park, located at 243 Jay Street, Brooklyn, NY 11201 between Tillary Street and Catherdral Place to light the flameless candles provided by Knot My Baby at 7pm. If you arrive after we have left, feel free to continue across the bridge as we will be walking slowly and taking pictures as we reach the midway point of the bridge.

Thereafter, participants are encouraged but not required to join us for dinner at AppleBee's located at 395 Flatbush Avenue Extension, Metro Tech, Brooklyn, NY 11201 directly after for their dine and donate program. Our local AppleBee's has decided to join us on this night of remembrance and donate 10% of every meal purchased by our group on October 15th, 2015 only. You must submit the promotional flyer provided in your participant bag to your server in order for AppleBee's to donate 10% of your purchase.

#goPINKandBLUE

IN ORDER TO RECEIVE THE LOCATION, RSVP HERE: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1WqRVs6FtcdxPX98K4b0RK4yr2qO2f0ss--OpYJGarEQ/viewform

Our event in NYC will be part of the International Event → https://www.facebook.com/events/669642313172865/ , coordinated by The Liberators International in cities all over the world and your participation will help create a global video message for peace and human connection for years to come.

The Intention, The Moment, the Worldly Event :

To engage the community in a moment of meaningful human connection.
To connect with yourself and others on a deeper level.
To record the action on video so we can create a global video message for peace and our shared humanity.

It's Human Connection time!

5pm to 8pm.

DUE TO SIZE OF THE FACEBOOK RESPONSE, OUR MANHATTAN LOCATION WILL BE RELEASED VIA EMAIL.

PLEASE RSVP HERE: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1WqRVs6FtcdxPX98K4b0RK4yr2qO2f0ss--OpYJGarEQ/viewform

Seeking: Videographers, FilmMakers, Photographers, Eye-Gazers, People "Wranglers" - encouraging passer-bys to join us, Social Media promoters, PR, Writers, Journalists

YOUR HOST and EVENT ORGANIZER:

The Connection Movement is an oasis and playground for connection. www.ConnectionMovement.com

The ever-growing community comes together to explore ways of seeing, connecting, and appreciating yourself and others at a deeper level through social, workshop, and retreat settings.

There are 6-10 gatherings per month that engage vulnerability, earnest connection and playing full out. Newcomers are welcomed with open arms and do not need to have prior experience.

Our gatherings and work together are inspired by the practices and teachings of Circling, Authentic World, Ken Wilber’s Integral Theory, Mindfulness, Morehouse, Meditation and NonViolent Communication.

Originally founded in 2012 by Amy Silverman and Dan Sieling, as Authentic Relating NYC, The Connection Movement is directed and facilitated by Amy Silverman. Check out her website www.AmySilverman.com

results.description:
Passion: What Software Teams and Executive Leadership Might Learn About Creating Lasting Change from ... Eco-pirates

Register early and save at http://nyspin201510.eventbrite.com/?aff=nyspinmeetup

Schedule
5:30 Networking
6:10 Community Announcements
6:20 Featured Speaker with Q&A
7:20 Raffle, Meet the Speaker

Synopsis: What can software teams and their leadership learn from the passion and self-organizing attributes of environmental activists and "eco-pirates" like those featured in the Animal Planet TV series, "Whale Wars"? Off the coast of Taiji Japan, free, migrating dolphins are ambushed at sea and driven by a fleet of boats to a once secret cove, where they're captured for the theme park industry and slaughtered for food. This is featured in the Oscar-winning documentary, "The Cove." Join Michael Mah as he shares his travels with Sea Shepherd which is committed to bringing the world's attention to stop this practice. Hear how environmental conservation teams 1) channel a powerful sense of purpose, 2) practice leadership, 3) use social media, 4) create transparency, 5) build trust, and 6) use metrics and data to command the world's attention. Hear Michael's take on what passionate teams muster to move a needle towards a "tipping point," and lessons that your software teams can learn from activist teams in the global environmental conservation movement to bring the quality of their work to new heights.

Speaker: Michael Mah is managing partner at QSM Associates Inc. He teaches, writes, and consults to technology companies on estimating and managing software projects, whether in-house, offshore, waterfall, or agile. He is also director of the Benchmarking Practice at the Cutter Consortium, a US-based IT think-tank. With over 25 years of experience, Michael and his partners at QSM have derived productivity and quality patterns for thousands of projects collected worldwide.  His work examines time-pressure dynamics of teams, and its role in project success and failure. His background is in physics and electrical engineering, and he is a mediator specializing in conflict resolution for technology projects. He is also a private pilot and lives in the mountains of Western Massachusetts.
results.name: Michael Mah: Passion -- Learning from Eco-pirates [see full title below]

John Morina of Pueblo Systems, Inc. will present a number of easy uses for ExecuteSQL(), along with some a bit more complex. He will also demo a cool trick for searching by variable criteria in list view and how to mark records under a sub summary.

2) Smackdown on 23rd Street: DESIGN Masterclass Sneak Peek

Albert Harum-Alvarez’ DESIGN Masterclass is offered in Sag Harbor Nov. 5-9. Get a taste of the class that “Hurts so Good” at the NYFMP.org meeting October 15th:

“The DESIGN Masterclass hurt like a deep tissue massage. But I kept coming back for more!” — Rob Russell, Auckland NZ

Albert is not nice. Well, he’s a nice guy, but he doesn’t pull any punches. If you want to see what I mean, then come see him that Thursday night at Tekserve. Three reasons to come:

1. There are other great speakers!
2. You might get SMACKED for free—that’s consulting that Albert charges top dollar for.
3. Come that night, and you’ll get a $500 discount to the DESIGN Masterclass!
The DESIGN Masterclass is the advanced degree of the FileMaker world. Albert has taught it for 15 years on four continents. One student called it…

“The best class I ever took. It changed my life!” — Dr. Florence Haseltine, The National Institutes of Health.

This is a class you can bill for, meaning you can get actual meaningful design work done on your app or solution. Some students pay for the entire cost of the class and still have some money left over. And some students return to the class two and three times:

“When I took Albert’s Design Masterclass for the third time, I thought that perhaps its impact on me would finally wane. But four months later, I was still experiencing revelations about my own design work!”
— Coletta Perry, Avatar DPS

More quotes at DESIGNmasterclass.co

So turn out on Thursday, Oct. 15th, and see what all the fuss is about. Come early for ring-side seats! Learn more about the DESIGN Masterclass here:

SmallCo. Helping your team work.

smallco.net

3) Readable FileMaker code: Simple Custom Functions (and Calculations)

Tony White Designs, Inc. believes in readable FileMaker code…better for clients, the health of the FileMaker platform, and developer sanity!

Tony White will demonstrate the only correct way to write a simple FileMaker Custom Function…something that all FileMaker developers can agree on ;-)

All kidding aside, come to the meeting and join the conversation!

4) Bring your FileMaker questions and ask the audience. It is amazing how many problems a group of FileMaker developers can solve.

5) Picks and Tips of the Month: Short bits or bytes of interest to our NYFMP.org group members.

results.description:
Please Signup at: (https://www.eventbrite.com/e/judy-yero-learnings-from-my-recent-visits-to-student-centered-schools-registration-19026268080)

This inaugural conversation with octogenarian learner, teacher, trainer, and author will be facilitated by NYC principal, Jamaal Bowman, of Cornerstone Academy for Social Action.

Judy's interest in the neurosciences and experience as a teacher led her to writing Teaching In Mind: How Teacher Thinking Shapes Education (http://www.teachinginmind.com/Preface.html), the preface from which is copied below, followed by Judy and Jamaal's biographies.

Judy will share the evolution of her thinking regarding our education system, why she is doing a nationwide tour to research student-centered schools, the surprises she encountered, the people who inspired her, and other stories.
***

Teaching In Mind, Preface

When I imagine young children engaged in the process of learning, the scene is dynamic. The faces of those children are alight with wonder, with puzzlement, with interest, and yes, with joy. When I imagine students in many of today's classrooms, that image is often static. Locked into a system of learning that too often becomes habitual, the faces of many young people in our schools register boredom, disinterest, or resignation to their fate.

Early in my teaching career, I recognized my need to guide the educational development of young people in ways that didn't, at the same time, take the joy out of their lives. I reasoned that my classroom environment must effectively support the natural ways in which children learn.

In the mid-80s, after taking numerous postgraduate courses in the neurosciences, I worked to bridge the gap between emerging knowledge of the brain and the practices of education. Eventually, I shared the ideas with other teachers in workshops entitled "Learning from the Inside Out." At the close of each workshop, I asked participants to comment on the ideas they had found the most valuable. To my surprise, rather than choosing what they had learned about students, most of the teachers commented on how much they had learned about themselves!

Their comments made me realize the extent to which teachers are ignored in educational planning, except as purveyors of content chosen by others. Yet the beliefs and values that provide the unconscious foundation for teacher behavior, the metaphors that set the stages of their classrooms, and the mental models of the world through which they conceptualize their work, are highly individualistic. Rather than the constants they are often assumed to be, numerous studies suggest that the teacher may well be the most influential variable in the educational equation!

Substantive change in education is unlikely to occur until educators understand how each teacher's beliefs about the nature of teaching and learning, and the metaphors they use to describe their teaching, influence everything that occurs in the classroom. Teaching in Mind: How Teacher Thinking Shapes Education examines those issues and more. In its pages, I will encourage you to probe the realms of subjective experience—the beliefs, values, presuppositions, and metaphors that shape your personal world.

The very word subjective makes some researchers in the social sciences cringe. Research is supposed to be based on objectivity. Education has prided itself on applying the scientific approach. Any recommendations for change must be supported by "hard data"—by research studies scrupulously conducted using the scientific method. Messy subjective concepts such as beliefs and values don't lend themselves to measurement or statistical manipulation.

In the past several decades, theorists have finally begun to recognize the importance of what goes on in the mind of an individual teacher. Research studies have explored the effects of teacher beliefs, the metaphors a teacher uses to describe his or her work, and the values a teacher assigns to a particular practice or concept. The studies have found that these thought processes have a profound influence on educational choices. But the results of those studies have been largely limited to academia. It is time for practicing teachers to have access to these ideas. It is the minds of those teachers that must be explored. It is the actions of those teachers that make education what it is today.

Although my conclusions are my own, I've attempted to include support from as many different disciplines as possible. The references are there for those who want or need them. However, many teachers are less interested in theory than in how they can improve their teaching experience and the experience of their students. The main thrust, therefore, is immediate applicability. It's about what you can do today to be the teacher who matters to students.

You may be astounded at how differently teachers think—even about the meanings of the words teach, learn, or understand. I invite you to let your own experiences verify the validity of these ideas, rather than some distant study or some theorist's perceptions. Take the ideas you can use and leave the rest for others who may hold different perceptions and have different experiences.

Despite the wishes of theorists, visionaries, and "experts," there are no simple answers to problems as complex as those educators presently face. If you agree with the adage, "If what you're doing doesn't work, do something else," you will find many ideas to enlarge your repertoire of "something else."

I sense that many teachers have reached the same level of frustration as people living under Communism when the Berlin Wall fell. In that case, a handful of people who'd had enough rebelled, creating the first breach in the Communist wall—both literally and figuratively. When a relatively small percentage of people create stress in a social system, the entire system shifts to relieve that stress. I invite you to imagine as I do what our schools might be like if they became places where students and teachers alike shared the joyous and innate love of learning with which infants comes into the world.

A handful of reflective teachers have it within their power to literally "change the face of education." Let us begin.

***

Judy Yero Bio

Education -

•BA from Dominican University: major in Chemistry/Physics; minor in Philosophy •MA in Curriculum Development from DePaul University •Doctoral coursework completed at the University of Illinois; dual focus on neurophysiology and education—taught teacher education classes as part of the doctoral program


•Master’s/Trainer level certification in Neurolinguistics

Teaching experience -

•Taught 7th-8th grade physical science (3 years) •Taught chemistry, physics, and physical science at a 3,000 student suburban Chicago high school (20 years)


•Science department chair—6 years Professional Organizations


•Served on textbook evaluation, curriculum, and other national committees for the National Science Teachers Association (NSTA), the American Association for the Advancement of Science (AAAS), and the Association for Science and Curriculum Development (ASCD) •Served on the joint NSTA-NASA committee that chose the first student-designed projects to be performed in space


•Teacher workshops: "Learning From the Inside Out."

More about Judy on her website: http://teachinginmind.com/

***

Jamaal Bowman Bio

Jamaal Bowman is a husband, father of three, and Founding Principal of Cornerstone Academy for Social Action (C.A.S.A.) Middle School in the Bronx. Jamaal received his Bachelor’s degree in Business from the University of New Haven in May 1999 and immediately began his teaching career at P.S. 90 in the South Bronx. After spending five years at P.S. 90, Jamaal moved on to serve as the Dean of Students at the High School for Arts and Technology. In 2008, Jamaal was accepted into New Leaders for New Schools and spent the year writing the proposal for C.A.S.A. while interning at Achievement First Endeavor Charter School. Jamaal is a Certified Business Teacher, Guidance Counselor, and School Building Leader. He has used all of his personal and professional experience to build the vision, mission, tone, and foundation of Cornerstone. C.A.S.A., now in its 6th year, has been celebrated for its exemplary school culture, high student achievement, and innovative student centered practices. C.A.S.A. students consistently attend some of the top high schools in New York City including Bronx Science and Brooklyn Latin, and are offered accelerated coursework in Algebra, Living Environment, and English. Jamaal was born and raised in the East Harlem/Yorkville section of New York City, and is a descendent of the Public Enemy, KRS-1, and Rakim thread of hip hop culture. Jamaal is an avid sports fan and vivacious reader, and believes that design thinking, creativity and collaboration will change the world.
results.name: Judy Yero:  Learnings From My Visits To Student-Centered Schools

In the domain of Lamordia, Doctor Victor Mordenheim created Adam, cobbling the creature together from parts of human corpses. Now, years later, Adam wants revenge. Adam wants Elise, Victor's wife. Adam wants Victor dead.

The players' ship founders on the coast of the domain of Lamordia. A vicious storm leaves them washed ashore, cold and hungry on the ice-bound Isle of Agony... then, the terror begins.

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners).  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking?

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers?

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life.

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
All Bisexual, Non-monosexual, and all other Queer-identified and Bi-friendly people are invited to come join people from the greater NYC Area in a lively topic oriented discussion at  BiRequest's famously open, non-judgmental, safe space. If you can't make it to the meeting, feel free to join everyone afterward around "eight-fifteenish" for dinner.

about us: Thanks to the dedication and hard work of many good bisexual folk, BiRequest is a bisexual social discussion group serving the New York City metropolitan area since January 1994. We provide a safe space for bisexuals and bi-friendly people to gather and discuss issues of importance to us.

We're a co-ed group for adults from 18 to 80-plus who meet twice a month every 1st and 3rd Thursday evening at NYC's LGBT Center in the West Village. The meetings are moderated and focused on a discussion topic but not limited to that week's topic.

After the discussion group session, at 8 o'clock we go to dinner at a nearby, reasonably-priced restaurant for socializing and more informal discussion. We also have occasional social events such as movie nights, parties, and much more. Join us for a meeting or event and find the community you've been looking for!

People who can't make it to the meeting are invited to join our private online group BiRequest on Yahoo or on our Facebook Page BiRequest on Facebook.

results.description:
Is your resume communicating how you can help a prospective employer in the 15 seconds a hiring manager is going to look at it? Are you positioning yourself correctly for the job you want, or are you too focused on your last job?

Robert Hellmann of Hellmann Career Consulting (www.hellmannconsulting.com) reviews examples of resumes and pitches (what you tell interviewers and others about your experience) from actual job search “success stories” to get the facts straight about what works, and what doesn't. Learn how to write an effective resume and craft a compelling pitch that will help you get and ace interviews. The discussion includes:

Before and after resume examples, so you can clearly see what works
Nine resume “do’s” and six resume “don’ts” that will debunk a lot myths and save you time
For career and industry-changers, how to relate your prior experience to what you’re looking to do next
How to address common issues, like gaps in your resume, too-much or too-little experience, or job-hopping
In-class exercises that will get you started on your resume and pitch Click here for more SIBL programs and classes!

Seating is on a first come, first seated basis unless otherwise noted.
results.name: Resume & “Pitch” Intensive - Craft Messages that Land Interviews and Offersm

Here's the info: 

The Fango screening of MOMENTUM will be a free show; to obtain tickets, send an e-mail to[masked]. You must list “MOMENTUM” as your subject line and provide us your full name. Offer is good for you and one guest. Names will be checked at the door. Offer is first come, first served, and we will confirm your RSVP. Seating is not guaranteed, however. This exclusive event is presented by our pals at Starz Digital, who releases MOMENTUM to theaters, iTunes and On Demand on October 16th.

So fasten your seatbelts and come catch MOMENTUM on October 15th. Fango editor emeritus Tony Timpone will be hosting the show. Plus stop by tomorrow for another Fangoria.com screening announcement—we have a bunch this month!

FANGORIA will be hosting a free screening of MOMENTUM, a non-stop action flick that will have you on the edge of your seat, in New York City on Thursday, October 15th at 7 p.m. This special showing will be held at the swanky Helen Mills Theater [masked] West 26 Street. A hit at this summer’s Fantasia Film Festival (which called MOMENTUM a “captivating action thriller…filled with spectacular stunts and bare-fisted fury”), MOMENTUM stars Olga Kurylenko (QUANTUM OF SOLACE), James Purefoy (THE FOLLOWING) and Morgan Freeman. Directed by Stephen S. Campanelli, a long-time Clint Eastwood collaborator, MOMENTUM was written by Adam Marcus (JASON GOES TO HELL) and Debra Sullivan, who last penned the hit film TEXAS CHAINSAW 3D.

YOU MUST ALSO RSVP HERE: oktoberfestnyt.splashthat.com

Join your fellow creatives and entrepreneurs from the Inside Startups community for Oktoberfest: A Fall Party for Entrepreneurial NYC hosted by NextView Ventures. 


About Oktoberfest: "NextView recently set up shop in New York and we got together with a few friends who said that it's been awhile since there was a New York startup event that was simply for the sake of having a party... So we're throwing one in October and would love for you to come!"


RSVP to this Meetup if you're attending Oktoberfest and you want to FOR SURE know someone there. 

Note: Inside Startups is not a partner or host for this party. Some of us are going, and parties are more enjoyable when you're with a group you know, so don't miss out on a chance to make new friends in the startup community!

Wait up. How do we find each other at the party?

Prior to the event, anyone who said "Yes" to this Meetup will get a note about where our group is meeting. Throughout the evening, Inside Startups' Director, Ali Nicolas, will keep you posted (via email) about the majority of our crew's location. 

Don't worry: you don't have to hang with our posse the whole time. You can roam the party at your leisure because you are, most likely, an adult.

TL; DR: 

• You must RSVP via Meetup & also here

• Party with old and new friends from Inside Startups' community

• Enjoy the event hosted by NextView and make even more new friends

ABOUT INSIDE STARTUPS

Since 2011, Inside Startups has connected great people with cool job opportunities in the startup scene by hosting events, sending a weekly newsletter and managing a directory with 600+ startups. Check it: insidestartups.org

Based in NYC, Inside Startups is run by Ali Nicolas, former VP People at OMGPOP. The founder is Dan Porter, former President of Teach for America, SVP Corp Dev at Virgin USA and CEO of OMGPOP. Currently, Ali and Dan work together on the digital team at leading sports and entertainment agency, WME | IMG.

Questions? Wanna work together? 

Contact: [masked]

Twitter: @insidestartups

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4_VNQhI8K-g

Introduction to Hydroponics: Grow your own, Herbs, Fruits, and Vegetables

Build in class will follow, check the calendar for the next Build-in Class

Come Learn the new and exciting innovations in Hydroponics.

Hydroponic Gardening is Simple and Easy

Hydroponics is basically growing plants without soil. It is a more efficient way to provide food and water to your plants. Plants don’t use soil – they use the food and water that are in the soil. Soil’s function is to supply plants nutrients and to anchor the plants’ roots. In a hydroponic garden, you provide your plants with a complete nutrient formula and an inert growing medium to anchor your plants’ roots so they have easier access to the food and water.

Arduino integration - look down below for more info (This allows automation and fine tuning for maximum growth results)

This intro class is to inform you of all the types of systems and how to get started into hydroponics in your own house.

This class will use hands on activities to get you excited about growing your own fresh food.

The topics will vary based on each classes members and specific needs but can include the following topics:

• Advantages of Hydroponic Growing

• Hydroponic system types - 6 main types and how you can combine them.

• Hydroponic components - Growing lights, Growing media, Growing tents.. etc

• Pumps and irrigation

• Tents and Tarps

• Pots and containers

• Water Filtration

• Automation via Arduino

The advantages of hydroponic gardening:


With hydroponics, plants are able to thrive, producing more flavorful and abundant yields.

The elimination of soil eradicates soil-borne disease.

Water is delivered to the plant more efficiently, and none is diverted to nearby weeds.

Plants can be grown in closer proximity than with traditional field-grown methods.

A small indoor garden can be cultivated year-round, yielding produce with higher nutritional value than soil-based crops.

Once you learn the basics in this class come in for the Build-in class, Bring your own materials and build your new Hydroponic system to take home and begin growing !

Arduino integration - Automation using the Micro Controller known as an arduino Build your own hydroponic monitor and control systems! Use Arduino to make your own LED Light Array, Temperature and Humidity Monitor, Fan Controllers, pH meters, EC meters, Water Tank Systems,  Sprinklers and much more. Whatever you want to monitor and control with an Arduino, you can make it! Follow our tutorials and create your own hydroponic devices.


Check the Meetup class schedule for the next Hydroponic Build-in

results.description:
Graybar Toastmasters is open to all who wish to improve their public speaking and leadership skills. In addition, this is a great way to network with a dynamic and diverse group of professionals.

Founded in 1954, we are one of the oldest Toastmasters clubs in New York City. We are a friendly club with members dedicated to helping each other become better speakers.

We meet from 6:15pm to 8:15pm on the 1st and 3rd Thursdays of each month in the same location. 

Our meetings are structured to allow everbody participate, practice and learn.

In our meetings the members of the club take different roles that allow them to practice and improve their public speaking and leadership skills by completing different projects.

The different roles include giving prepared presentations, chairing the meeting, improvising a short speech, telling a joke, giving feedback to speakers, evaluating the whole meeting, among others, all in a very friendly and supportive environment.

People who RSVP this meetup attend as guests. They introduce themselves at the beginning of the meeting and give feedback at the end, and some of them may participate in an improv exercise, this is an opportunity for you to check out the club coming to one or a couple of meetings, and decide if you want to join as an active member.


To learn more about Toastmasters International please visit http://www.toastmasters.org/

See you there!

results.description:
Join the conversation: http://slack.cdnyc.co

</a>

-------------------------------------------------- 

Sign-in & networking at 6:15, talks at 6:45. 

Pizza and craft beer provided by Load Impact.

--------------------------------------------------  

SYNOPSIS

The Future of Web Performance with Robin Gustafsson, CTO of Load Impact

In this talk, Robin will outline the evolution of performance testing since the widespread adoption of DevOps, Continuous Delivery and Agile Development strategies. Then he’ll take a look into where the space is headed.

HTTP/2 vs. HTTP/1.1: A Performance Analysis by Ragnar Lonn, founder of Load Impact

HTTP/2 is about to happen – most major browser and server makers are working on support for HTTP/2 and some, like Firefox, already have it enabled by default. The protocol is backwards-compatible with HTTP/1.1 and is likely to suddenly become ubiquitous when new versions of clients and servers switch it on. But the web development community is still largely ignorant about HTTP/2 and what it means for their applications.

This talk will outline the results of a new study by Ragnar Lonn, founder of Load Impact, where we attempt to measure the performance impact different types of applications would typically face if they switch their data transport from HTTP/1.1 to HTTP/2.

As an extra treat, Ragnar will also release the software created as part of the study — a free online tool for developers to find out what happens performance-wise if their site or application is delivered over HTTP/2 instead of HTTP/1.1.

--------------------------------------------------

BIO

<a href="https://twitter.com/xebialabs"></a>

Load Impact CTO Robin Gustafsson is a system architecture expert who’s been working with the company since it was founded in 2009. Robin specializes in performance testing, software architecture, cloud and distributed computing, and Continuous Delivery in software development.

Ragnar Lonn is founder and CEO of Load Impact, the world’s most popular online load testing service for testing the performance of websites. Load Impact users have executed over 300,000 load tests since 2009. Previously Ragnar worked in the ISP industry, and founded one of Sweden’s first internet service providers (Algonet, 1994). His more unexpected interests include running, macroeconomics, and energy storage technologies.

--------------------------------------------------

SPONSOR

This event is hosted by <a href="http://betterment.com/">Betterment.

Betterment is a hands-off automated investing service for long term savings goals with a personalized, globally diversified portfolio. Betterment has the lowest fees in the industry, and eliminates the typical complexities of investments (like rebalancing and dividend reinvesting), all while optimizing for taxes at a lower cost.
results.name: HTTP/2 and the Future of Web Performance

Simon will channel the VortexHealing® energies and divine essences. He will channel from the deepest levels of divine consciousness, releasing and awakening the deepest levels of emotional blocks and negative conditioning from your system. Imagine a vast set of divine frequencies and energies so powerful that there is no limit to where they can heal and transform. VortexHealing® creates powerful healing acceleration, releases karmic blocks, cleanses chakras, powerfully shifts your reality to higher divine expressions while connecting to your angels, guides and deities.

As Joel & Simon, continue to work together, envision Guided Meditation and Vortex Healing® complimenting each other. Notice the words take on more power, the energy flowing more strongly deeply. And find yourself opening more to your unconscious, Divine Consciousness and Spiritual awakening.

Imagine releasing the mental and energetic blocks that disconnect you from yourself and from the divine in times of stress and crisis.

Imagine feeling the energies inspire the words, and the words guide your energies.

Imagine opening your awareness to encompass the dance between these elements each time going deeper, and deeper, places you weren’t even aware of, helping you create more change, more release.
Imagine feeling  new hope, new ideas re-energized.

What to Expect: We create a safe and comfortable space, and take the time to answer any questions you might have. Typically, there are 2-3 rounds of guided meditation and Vortex Healing® combined. In each round, Simon and Joel work together. Joel guides the meditation with words, creating trance. And Simon channels the Vortex Healing® energies.

Each round, words, energies and trance will blend together, taking deeper into mind, body, energy and soul to create more profound effects. Who is this class for? This class is for anyone who is curious about experiencing hypnosis, energy work and wants to make change in their life. What’s required for this class? Just bring yourself, an openness to new experience and the possibility of change.

=================================

Simon Deacon’s website and more info about Vortex Healing

* THIS IS NOT AN ASIAN SPECIFIC EVENT. ALL ARE WELCOME TO ATTEND.

PRICE: $34  (Must Pre-Pay Online. No Tickets Sold At Event Door)
(We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because once we fill up for a certain gender we will list event as sold out for that gender. Sign up now to secure your spot).

The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup

EVENT DETAILS:
Speed dating is so much fun and a great way to meet quality, single professionals in the busy city of NYC. Most people know within a few minutes if they would like to see someone again. We may be biased but we definitely think this is a much better way to meet people than online dating or at a random bar.

You will go on between 8 and 15 mini dates lasting between 4 and 7 minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

Get Your Tickets At This Link: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speed-dating-in-nyc.html

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

This is a joint event with The British Film and Television Meetup Group.

This screening is sold out.  Please change your RSVPs if you do not have a ticket.

Benedict Cumberbatch (Sherlock; The Imitation Game) stars as the melancholy Danish prince along with Ciaran Hinds, Anastasia Hille, and Sian Brooke in Shakespeare's most introspective tragedy.  Tickets to the National Theatre itself have been selling out since this was announced.

This will be broadcast live to the UK, continental Europe, and the US.  The international vibe will be absolutely smashing!

If you wish to read the play first the entire text is here.

TICKETING INFORMATION

Please adjust your e-mail notifications to allow you to receive updates to this event, which will sell out long before the performance date.

results.description:
How to maximize your chance of getting a job in VR -Ron Fosner of Framestore:  VR is a hot new technology, but since hardly anyone has any experience in it - what proactive things can you do to give yourself the best chance of getting a real, paying job in the VR industry? Ron will discuss what you can do to give yourself the best shot, and what skills and activities will increase your chances.


Ron Fosner has been involved in real-time PC graphics for over 20 years, Mobile graphics for 5, and VR for 2. He's currently Sr. Dev leading the VR development group at Framestore NYC's VR Studio, where he's building up the VR Studio engineering team and infrastructure. Prior to Framestore he was a Sr. Developer Relations engineer at Intel. 


Live Streaming and Brand Building in VR - Richard Cumming of Two Goats:  New York City, London and Beijing: Two Goats Creative Partnership is an international, multidisciplinary creative production studio for brands and their agencies.  As passionate advocates for the global design and technology community, we curate strategic partnerships and ensure that consumers world-wide benefit from world-class brand experiences.  We work with the best design and technology specialists and with the world’s biggest brands and agencies. And our in-house expert account and production teams are here to manage the end-to-end production process.

As always, please bring your VR demos and your rigs to share VR with the community.

Please let us know if you have a start up, project, or area of expertise that you would like to present at one of our events.  We would love to hear from you.

Please be advised that by attending any NY VR event and / or trying out any VR technology demo, you are indicating your agreement to the terms of the NY VR Waiver and Release of Liability Form, which can be found HERE
results.name: October NYVR Meetup

results.description:
Come and meet our community of local real estate investors, build your network, and learn why real estate is IDEAL and why you should be involved with our community of real estate investors. We constantly learn & earn together and have fun together. Within our real estate investing community, we train people with no experience to people who have been working in the real estate field for many years. So it's not important what experience you have! Working with our community, you will learn in depth knowledge of how real estate investing strategies work and you will also develop yourself to be a successful real estate entrepreneur.

At this meeting we talk about the biggest money making opportunities (Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy & Holds, Seller Financed Notes + Tax Liens/Deeds, Multi-Family/Commercial and Money Lending) for a Real Estate Investor in today’s market. You will get to learn about new investors that are investing in real estate and making $10,000-$100,000+ per real estate transaction, we will also talk about how you can make $1,000-$10,000 commissions helping our community grow and you will learn working strategies from professional and practicing Real Estate Investors on how to create wealth through real estate investing.. This way you can learn & earn, get educated so you can invest in real estate, enjoy your life and pass your wealth on to future generations. Because we will cover a LOT of things in a short amount of time such as saving money on taxes, investment opportunities and other ways to make money working with our team, only those who attend the orientation will get invited to private follow up meetings to cover more in depth advanced strategies and working with our community.

To attend, simply RSVP & answer the registration questions for location! If you would like to bring a friend or business partner with you to the meeting, please email us their name, email address and phone number so that we can make sure they are registered for the meeting.
results.name: Learn About Our Real Estate Investing Community, Training & Income Opportunity!

At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

results.description:
We seldom have the opportunity to explain the details of our code when someone needs to modify it. We may not even be working in the company any longer! This can make code difficult to understand, increasing the time required to make even a relatively simple change. Can we write code that more clearly indicates our intent and is easier for other developers to understand? 

In this fun hands-on session, we'll create a lab environment where we'll experiment with silent pair programming - pairing without speaking a word to each other! 

Please bring a laptop with your favorite IDE and language. Have a project setup with dependencies for doing Test Driven Development.

Whether you're experienced with TDD or never tried it before, this is a great exercise for improving your development practices. Come join us!

• 630 - 700 pm:  Networking and pizza

• 700 - 830 pm: Hands-on exercise
results.name: Hands-on session: Intention revealing code

results.description:
Join us at our next meeting by emailing us at [masked] to help our two writers on deck to workshop their scripts. You'll perform their pages in front of the group and then everyone is welcome to give the writer feedback. (Members are also welcome to just observe, and not act, if they prefer!)

We coordinate our casts through email, and not MeetUp, so be sure to email us if you want to be cast in a role.

Please view our website to sign up or for more info: www.TheWagNY.com

results.description:
Stocks are entering a bear market pattern globally with the drop beginning in China with the devaluation of the yuan. Central banks are once again desperately trying to save the market, as they did last October. QE (quantitative easing), and zero percent interest rates, which have fed the market rally since 2008, seem to be losing their effectiveness however-- something that inevitably happens with all stimulus. 

AGENDA:

6:30-6:40 - Introduction to Group 

6:40 - 7:20 - Daryl Montgomery: "Economic and Market Review of Stocks, Bonds, Currencies and Commodities." The charts have turned bearish. In our September meeting, we showed how only the Nasdaq chart still looked OK, but since then the death cross has taken place. 



7:20 - 7:35 - Intermission


7:35-8:10 - David Harris, PhD: "What the Market Topping/Bottoming Model Indicates Now." David's model predicted a possible top in the Dow in May and this did indeed take place. 

8:10 - 8:30 - Kelly Killian: "Update on Real Estate"

There is a $10 admission fee to the meeting.
results.how_to_find_us: Show guards your picture ID and go to 15th Floor

results.description:
While founders focus on critical decision points, they often end up overlooking one of the most important areas of the venture's development: Startups-legal matters. 

Join me as I pick the brains of Louis Liu,Leading New York corporate lawyer as we discuss the various legal issues that need to be addressed by the founders and startups at an early stage like structuring of the company's initial capitalization, issuance of founder stock, vesting and acceleration for founder stock, election of the company's board and officers, and seed capital. 

Agenda

6:30 - Welcome note & Networking.

6:45 - Introduction 

7:00 - Q&A with Louis Liu

7:45 - Audience interaction & Query session

8:00 - Networking over Beer & Snacks

Topics for discussion

1)  When do you need to form a company? 
(2)  What are the benefits of formally form a company? 
(3)  The differences between LLC, LP, C-Corporation, S-Corporation and what is the right type of entity for you? 
(4)  What are the proper procedures to set up a company? 
(5)  What if we have done a lot of work already before forming the company?  
(6) What are the key issues that should be addressed in the legal documents to ensure that the team will work well together toward a common goal? 
(7)  What are the mechanics to deal with team members who do not perform or leave without good reason? 
(8)  How do you find the appropriate lawyers for your company's legal need?

About Louis Liu;

General corporate lawyer, has advised start-up companies, strategic buyers to private equity funds to consummate billions of dollars of venture capital/private equity investments, mergers & acquisitions and commercial lending. he now runs his own law firm (www.liubusinesslaw.com) mostly advising start-up companies for their equities and/or grocery money.

https://www.linkedin.com/pub/zhiping-louis-liu/3b/a41/975
results.name: Startups legal-Matters; Roundtable Discussion & Networking

results.description:
This route is a 5K that goes through the streets of Ridgewood and Midland Park. We meet at Ridgewood Coffee Company and hit the streets! Thanks to Bob for the route and thanks to Licinio for the name.

****Please wear reflective clothing, a reflective vest, and/or some kind of light if possible.  It's essential that we are visible to vehicles.


We meet outside Ridgewood Coffee Company, just across from the big clock in Ridgewood at the intersection of E. Ridgewood Ave. and Oak St. Ridgewood Coffee Company is right up the street from where we usually start when we start at the Duck Pond. There are benches outside if you feel like sitting down and there's coffee inside if you're sleepy. This is a fun route: it starts off in downtown Ridgewood, then it goes underground, below the train tracks, then it's back on the streets and the steady incline begins and persists for a bit. After that, it gets a lot easier. Just be ready for the incline. If you don't like hills, the incline will be a nice little challenge as it only lasts for less than half a mile. It's a good route as there are only a couple of situations where traffic can hold you up. Most of the run is on sidewalks.
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet at the corner on the sidewalk.
results.name: Bob's Run (aka Hitting the Streets of Ridgewood)

results.description:
A Hypnotic & Vortex Healing® Journey

1st Thursday of each month (date may vary)

6:30 – 8:30 PM (ending time may vary)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER


$35-regular price

$30-early bird (available until 1 week before event)

Please join us this evening to experience a fusion of 2 powerful  modalities -

•  Guided Meditation & Hypnosis

•  And VortexHealing®: Divine Energy Therapy

and how they can help you, and enjoy how wonderfully and synergistically they work together.

Do You Want to Learn More About Hypnosis, Energywork, Vortex Healing® or Spirituality?

Do You Have Something that is Troubling You, You Want Something Different from the Way Your Life is Going Right Now?

Are you stuck, uncertain, confused, frustrated or something else? You’re not sure if it’s emotional, energetic, mental or spiritual.

Come join Joel & Simon, and

• Let go of old thoughts, habits and beliefs

• Release blocked karma and energy

• Open gateways of mind and spirit

• Remove limitations

• Set new, more powerful intentions

• Heal old emotional issues

and begin to achieve your most heartfelt desires.

First timers, Experienced Journeyers, Come, Participate, Explore & Transform!

Give yourself this gift of healing and change


Experience Simon & Joel working together:

Joel will guide you into trance. Relaxing your mind and body, connecting you to your unconscious. Let his positive suggestions help you go deeper in trance, feel yourself become more receptive to Simon’s healing energies, divine consciousness and support healthy, ecological, appropriate change. As your trance deepens, imagine habits changing, limiting beliefs dissolving, new insights and subtle, rich, wonderful transformations occurring.

Simon will channel the VortexHealing® energies and divine essences. He will channel from the deepest levels of divine consciousness, releasing and awakening the deepest levels of emotional blocks and negative conditioning from your system. Imagine a vast set of divine frequencies and energies so powerful that there is no limit to where they can heal and transform. VortexHealing® creates powerful healing acceleration, releases karmic blocks, cleanses chakras, powerfully shifts your reality to higher divine expressions while connecting to your angels, guides and deities.

As Joel & Simon, continue to work together, envision Guided Meditation and Vortex Healing® complimenting each other. Notice the words take on more power, the energy flowing more strongly deeply. And find yourself opening more to your unconscious, Divine Consciousness and Spiritual awakening.

Imagine releasing the mental and energetic blocks that disconnect you from yourself and from the divine in times of stress and crisis.

Imagine feeling the energies inspire the words, and the words guide your energies.

Imagine opening your awareness to encompass the dance between these elements each time going deeper, and deeper, places you weren’t even aware of, helping you create more change, more release.
Imagine feeling  new hope, new ideas re-energized.

What to Expect: We create a safe and comfortable space, and take the time to answer any questions you might have. Typically, there are 2-3 rounds of guided meditation and Vortex Healing® combined. results.description:
While founders focus on critical decision points, they often end up overlooking one of the most important areas of the venture's development: Startups-legal matters.

Join me as i pick the brains of Louis Liu,Leading New York corporate lawyer as we discuss the various legal issues that need to be addressed by the founders and startups at an early stage like structuring of the company's initial capitalization, issuance of founder stock, vesting and acceleration for founder stock, election of the company's board and officers, and seed capital. 

Agenda

6:30 - Welcome note & Networking.

6:45 - Introduction

7:00 - Q&A with Louis Liu

7:45 - Audience interaction & Query session

8:00 - Networking over Beer & Snacks

Topics for discussion

1)  When do you need to form a company?
(2)  What are the benefits of formally form a company?
(3)  The differences between LLC, LP, C-Corporation, S-Corporation and what is the right type of entity for you?
(4)  What are the proper procedures to set up a company?
(5)  What if we have done a lot of work already before forming the company?  
(6) What are the key issues that should be addressed in the legal documents to ensure that the team will work well together toward a common goal?
(7)  What are the mechanics to deal with team members who do not perform or leave without good reason?
(8)  How do you find the appropriate lawyers for your company's legal need?

About Louis Liu;

General corporate lawyer, has advised start-up companies, strategic buyers to private equity funds to consummate billions of dollars of venture capital/private equity investments, mergers & acquisitions and commercial lending. he now runs his own law firm (www.liubusinesslaw.com) mostly advising start-up companies for their equities and/or grocery money.

results.description:
Come AWOL with us! (After Work Origami Lovers) 

After a long week what could be better than meeting with friends and potential new friends to fold your work week away! Come fold with us at AWOL!

Its a lot of fun and more intimate than our once a month big meetings. A great place to learn some new models and also get help on models you're been stuck on. Bring your latest folds and creations for show and tell and your favorite models to teach and learn.

This meeting is free and open to all level of folders from beginners to advanced. bring paper and your books and also there will always be free paper available to share so you can just show up and fold! 

Please try to RSVP so others will know you will be there.

Hope to see you there! happy folding!!

Due to the closing of Cosi at 23rd around 9pm. At this time this group will be meeting at Panera Breads near 28th and 29th, with a backup location meeting of Argo Tea near FIT. Panera closes at 10pm, and Argo closes at 11pm. 

Also I usually get there a bit earlier, so please look for paper folders, or at least the presence of paper. 

-Linda

NOTE: Please try to RSVP if possible so others will know you will be there. Thanks.
results.how_to_find_us: Typically look for us on the second floor or the presence of paper!

results.description:
Join Goodnik, Be Social Change and the New York Corporate Social Responsibility Meetup on Thursday, October 15th for a panel discussion on "The Future of Corporate Social Responsibility - Can Business Be Used as a Force for Good?" as we explore the trends, challenges, and best practices in CSR. 

There is a growing expectation that businesses take into account not only their bottom line but also the impact they have on society and the environment. Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is a business practice that involves company initiatives that give back - for example, donating a portion of proceeds to charity, minimizing carbon emissions and waste, organizing employee volunteer opportunities, or initiating cause-marketing programs - each designed to use business as a force for good.

With more companies integrating CSR practices, this panel discussion will explore the challenges and opportunities of using business to positively impact society and the environment. How do businesses meet these imperatives while maintaining their economic competitiveness? How can they measure, track, and report on the impact that CSR initiatives have on both their community and their bottom-line? And how will these trends affect the future of how we do business?

Drinks and snacks will be provided!

RSVP at the NYCSR Meetup page

Purchase ticket at bit.ly/BSCFoCSR

Meetup members receive 50% off tickets with the discount code "CSRNY50."

SCHEDULE 
6:30-7:00pm - Doors open, Check-in 
7:00-8:30pm - Program, Panel Discussion, Q&A 
8:30 - Closing & Networking

FEATURED PANELISTS 
Aman Singh, VP of Business + Social Purpose, Edelman 
David Korngold, Manager of Advisory Services, BSR 
Vera Oziransky, Project Manager, The Vitality Institute 
Laura James, HR Manager, UPS 
Marcos Salazar (Moderator), Co-Founder & Executive Director, Be Social Change
results.name: Partner Event: The Future of CSR

results.description:
Happy Monday, we have 3 new free spaces for our outdoor workshop. Please only RSVP if you are certain you can make the event. Please cancel as soon as know you cannot make it to free up your place. Thank you! 

FIELD TRIP NIGHT PHOTOGRAPHY: OCT 15, THURSDAY 6:30 PM-9:30 PM
This photography workshop starts at our facilities by reviewing the foundations of exposure as related uniquely to night photography. Students will test shoot all learned concepts and then head out to shoot a series of experimental key night images that will take their skills to the next level. This photo tour follows with plenty of shooting from ambiance, through motion blur to lighting effects and wonderful cityscapes. Class times are assigned so to capture part of dusk, weather permitting. Shooting areas will be Union Square park or the Highline (when possible). PhotoManhattan will provide Tripods as needed. Class is limited to 10 students. 

Requirements: basic knowledge of Manual exposure. And camera with Manual control of shutter-speed and aperture. 

NOTE: In case of rain, sessions will be rescheduled. We'l offer you the next available class thereafter.

See you there!

View other workshops or classes and Columbus day deal at: http://www.photomanhattan.com/photography-workshops-nyc-s/1896.htm

results.description:
Join us for our next Latin America Tech Meetup; Its theme will be joining a startup incubator, its process and benefits. 

  We will have a panel discussion with special guests from incubators and accelerators. The goal of the Latin America Tech Meetup is to connect the tech ecosystems of Latin America with the US and vice versa.

Lisa Besserman (StartupBuenosAires, Founder & CEO) - StartupBuenosAires SUBA, a community organization aimed to inspire, connect and support startups and entrepreneurship in Latin America. SUBA provides tools & resources to cultivate a strong and sustainable startup ecosystem in Buenos Aires. Lisa, has been named as Business Insider’s “Top 100 Most Influential Women in Tech” as well as the “Business Innovator of Latin America” by the Council of the Americas.

Fernando Fabre  (President - Endeavor Global) - Fernando is the current president of Endeavor Global. Immediately prior, he was the Managing Director of Endeavor Mexico since 2004. He currently serves on the board of the National Committee of Innovation which oversees a US$5 billion budget of the Mexican government on innovation;In 2003 the magazine Lideres Mexicanos called him a “Leader of the Future”; in 2005 Fortuna called him the “top entrepreneur supporter in Mexico”; and in 2007 Expansion called him one of the “30 under 30” Mexican leaders. 

Andrew Ackerman (Director, DreamIt Ventures) - Andrew Ackerman runs DreamIt Ventures New York accelerator program. One of the top 10 accelerators in the world with offices in New York, Philly, Austin, Baltimore, & Tel Aviv. Dreamit has helped launch over 200 startups (including Seatgeak, LevelUp, Meerkat, Adaptly, Elevate, etc.) who have collectively raised over $275M and who are worth in aggregate ~$1B. Ackerman began his career as a consultant to Fortune 100 companies and quickly turned his attention to tech when he worked for Kaplan Online. 

OUR HOSTS

Felipe Saenz, Felipe is the Founder & CEO of a startup to book musicians, co-organizer to Latam Tech and consultant to The Fourhundred magazine. The music startup is a platform to book musicians and for them, or their manager, to handle bookings.

Mario Valdez, born in Venezuela,and now based in NYC. Mario is the founder of a starup that deals with nutrition and fitness called traineat", and co-organizer to Latam Tech. He is also a former director of a television channel in venezuela now closed by the current regime. Mario is Lawyer and communication manager.

Special thanks to our proud sponsors:                      

 Amazon Web Services (AWS), a collection of remote computing services, also called web services, make up a cloud-computing platform offered by Amazon.com. These services operate from 11 geographical regions across the world. The most central and well-known of these services arguably include Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud and Amazon S3. Amazon markets these products as a service to provide large computing-capacity more quickly and more cheaply than a client company building an actual physical server farm.

San Francisco's Regional Center (SFRC), an organization dedicated to helping individuals and families understand how to obtain EB-5 visas. But just as important, our EB-5 approach is focused on stable, job generation projects that selectively qualify our investors for the ultimate results they seek – a permanent green card. We specialize in healthcare and call center projects to date that are based on secure, U.S.-approved projects that protect and deliver results for our investors.


Training. Technology. Translation.

T3 Training is a Manhattan based Training and Executive Coaching company that partners with VCs and Start-Ups to maximize investment and minimize risk, turning Start-Ups into Sustainable Investments. They focus on the development of Post Series A, Tech Start-Ups in the advertising, digital media and digital enterprise space. To schedule a get together with T3 Training email [masked] or call <a>[masked]</a>

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qR2prZm2hVc

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gRX0w3Sw_8Y

Description:

Spooky Halloween Chimes for a Haunted House!

With Halloween around the corner it's time to invoke all spooky spirits and what better way to do that than by building a quirky hardware project. In this workshop we will build several prototypes of musical chimes each one more scary than the other. 

Example Videos: 

Flower chimes https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2-iFNLQLxQc

Electric wind chimes https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gQoL5-CF7r4 


Materials provided:

• 5 bare touch conductive boards

• 2 makeymakey

• 1 arduino

• 1 tube of conductive thread

• 2 5-packages of alligator cables

• flowers

• aluminium foil

What you should bring: 

• Your computer with Arduino IDE installed and Baretouch Conductive Board drivers installed (follow instructions here: http://www.bareconductive.com/make/setting-up-arduino-with-your-touch-board/) 

• Headphones and/or little speakers (if you have any) 

• More materials for chimes (felt, bells, LEDs, anything else you can think of) 

What you can keep: the chimes you made

What you cannot keep: the boards provided

This workshop is free of charge, however, we really encourage you to bring more materials for chimes and to set-up Arduino on your computer to make the most out if it! 

Teacher: 

Stefania Druga

Innately curious and passionate about creating and testing new learning models, instructional designer by training, evolved into a learning architect. Stefania is also a former Googler and graduated from an international Erasmus Mundus master of Media Engineering for Education (France, Spain, Portugal). In the summer of 2012 she was also the Education Teaching Fellow at Singularity University where she advised and coached 80 students from 36 countries. Currently, she is leading Hackidemia organization (mobile lab for maker Education present in 40 countries), Afrimakers (community of Maker projects in 10 Africa countries) and MakerCamp (global camps for learning how to build and run makerspaces) Stefania is also an an ambassador for global MakerFaire in Berlin and Shenzhen and is preparing a new kit for maker education in schools. Currently she is a Flatiron School fellow and NYU visiting scholar and she is always looking for creative ways to combine hardware and software with art, music and design. 

Schedule: 

6:30 Arrive/Network/Food 
6:45 Welcome from Women Who Code and Fullstack 
7:00 Workshop begins 
9:15 Demo and enjoy your final prototype!

A valid photo ID will be required to enter the building. Please be sure to enter your full name when RSVPing for this event. 

Why is this event closed? RSVPs open 2 weeks in advance to ensure a higher attendance rate. So if the event is on October 15, you can start registering for it October 1.
results.name: Halloween Hardware Workshop @ Fullstack Academy

results.description: The North Face has joined the free fitness movement with the Mountain Athletics program. results.description:
This is a FREE yoga class that meets from 6:30 to 8:00 pm, instructed by Chia-Ti Chiu, one of the organizers of this Meetup group.

It is an OPEN LEVEL HATHA FLOW class, appropriate for beginners to advanced students.  There are many variations given to accommodate the different levels of yoga experience.


** You will need to bring your own mat.  There are no yoga mats for rent or use. You can buy yoga mats inexpensively at Marshalls, Filene's Basement, Modells, TJ Maxx, and Target. Many yoga studios also carry a wide range of mats for sale.

IF YOU COME FOR THE FIRST TIME: PLEASE FILL OUT THE REGISTRATION FORM AT THE FRONT DESK. RSVPing on Meetup does not count as Beacon registration.  Your participation and registration helps keep the numbers needed for this program to stay free!


FOR EVERYONE: PLEASE SIGN IN AT THE FRONT DESK CLEARLY AND LEGIBLY

DIRECTIONS:The Beacon Center is located in PS 198. It is an elementary school that takes up the whole block; entrance is on 3rd Ave. The exact address is: 1700 Third Avenue, between 95 & 96 St.

BY SUBWAY: 6 train to 96 St. Walk 1 block East on 96 St to Third Ave. Make a right onto Third Ave.

BY BUS: Third Ave Bus - M101, 102, 103 to 96 St.

Madison Ave Bus - M1, M2,M3, or M4 To 96 St.


ANY QUESTIONS? Contact Chia-Ti through Meetup or through her website: www.onelovewellness.com
results.how_to_find_us: Sign up at the front desk and they will direct you to the yoga room

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book The Mystic Path by Raymund Andrea.

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 12: Mystical Quietude.

You can download the book free here!

About the Book

Former Rosicrucian Grand Master Andrea discusses subjects of particular importance to all people traveling on the mystical path. This informative and inspirational work will guide you across the threshold of mystical initiation. The author provides insights into the states of consciousness and experiences you may have as you travel the mystic path. It is filled with the fire and paths of the initiate’s quest. His spiritual, mental, and physical crises are fully described and pondered. Andrea’s deep understanding of the essence of Western mystical and transcendental thought makes this a book you will treasure and refer to often as you advance in your mystical studies. Among the many topics addressed are: Meditation, Contemplation, Awakening Consciousness, the Dark Night of the Soul, Mystical Participation, and Mystical Union.

All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - The Mystic Path: Mystical Quietude

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. This group meets in the Sports Bar Restaurant in the rear of the building past the bowling lanes and pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Five Tribes, Kingsburg, Istanbul, Catan, Pirate's Cove, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Stone Age, Suburbia, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Lords of Waterdeep, Splendor, The Cave, and more.  

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Sports Bar Restaurant in the rear of the building past the bowling lanes and pool tables.
results.name: Thursday Night Board Games at Dave & Busters!

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！
results.name: Chinese and English Language Exchange

results.description:
We are thrilled to welcome back DALIEN, aka 13 HANDS for another Yoga and Sound Meditation Workshop at Welcome Ohm, this time focusing on the Solar Plexus Chakra. After a discussion and yoga for the solar plexus, DALIEN will be musically taking you into a nada yoga, dream like state with a 40 plus minute savasana with gongs, crystal bowls, hang drum, native flutes and other ambient percussion to assist you in relieving tension, entering a dream like state (samadhi) and will help integrate the entire experience.


To follow, light acoustic guitar will gently waken the body up from the savasana into a few really fun, interactive chants to integrate and ground the experience before you go home!

All levels of yoga experience or non-experience welcome.

Please bring a yoga mat and water. Cost is $35 and pre-registration/payment is required to RSVP and hold your space. Please paypal Sarah at [masked]. Thank you! See you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: We are in the same building as Healing Hands Chiropractic, parking in back. If parking lot is full, you can park across the street in the Wells Fargo Bank lot.
results.name: Solar Plexus Chakra Yoga & Sound Meditation with DALIEN, aka 13 HANDS

It's comfortable, affordable & centrally located.

results.description:
A “prompt” is a writing exercise with a specific theme and a time limit. These small exercises get writers to move away from their comfort zone and try a new genre, voice or character. Inspiration can be drawn from unlikely places and time limits lead to creativity.

JCW members provide the writing prompts on a rotating basis. These prompts can be anything the scheduled writer decides. The only rule is the group just has 10 minutes to write it!
results.how_to_find_us: kitchen
results.name: WRITING PROMPTS w/ Jim

results.description:
This month, Todd has suggested we go to his favorite, Casual Thai, a cozy and authentically decorated restaurant on Tenth and Washington. Casual Thai offers a wide range of selections, including traditional noodle-based dishes, flavorful hot curries, chef's specials, vegetarian entrees, soups, salads, and delectable appetizers. Prices range from $12 to $18 for entrees and from $5 to $8 for appetizers.

Check out the menu here: www.casual-thai.com

Casual Thai does not have a liquor license, but is BYOB, so you are welcome to bring your own wine or beer, which may be purchased at nearby Yash Wines and Liquors (1004 Washington St.).

Thanks, Todd, for being our host at what's sure to be an enjoyable  outing. Looking forward to seeing "regulars" and newcomers alike.

Note: If you RSVP "Yes," please have the courtesy to update your RSVP if you find you can't attend. We need an accurate count of people when making the reservation for this event.
results.name: Dinner at Casual Thai

results.description:
New York Tarot Tarotology is a class devoted to the study of the pictorial language of the Tarot. Have you ever wondered "What do the cards mean?" Or, "Why does every book you've looked at say the cards mean something else?" This class will answer both those questions. 

The on-going classes, will feature Tarot Symbolism, the Esoteric Titles assigned to each card in the Tarot as well as what each title means, Astrology and the Tarot, Qabalah and the Tarot, which includes a study of the Tree of Life,  Alchemy and the Tarot, as well as the History of the Tarot. 

All levels are welcome, even if this is your very first class.

Payment can be made in class. 


There will be a Meet-Up sign on the table and I will get to Panera Bread around 6:00 pm or before to ensure we have a table for our group.
results.how_to_find_us: Panera is near the corner of 33rd Street & 5th Ave. Closest subway is the F at 34th Street. Walk one block to 5th Ave. Turn right & walk down one block to 33rd. Street. We will be in the Cafe downstairs.

results.description:
We are partnering with our friends from MobileDevNJ as they are trying their first event out of the Hoboken area. Founded in 2010 and led by Alex Zaltsman, Brett DiDonato, and Daniel DiMassa, MobileDevNJ is a great technology-agnostic mobile development group that typically hosts several presenters at every meeting.

Agenda 7pm Start:

1) Pizza and networking.

2) Erik Kamp:

Why you need to start testing your apps today including some example libraries for Android. 

3) Nick Landry:

A quick run though of Visual Studio Emulator for Android.

4) Closing:

Microsoft had some big news on their Oct 6th announcement, lets get an expert recap and have a group discussion on it.

If you're a MMAD NJ regular, this is a great opportunity to come make some new friends. MobileDevNJ members are welcome to join MMAD NJ, but note that you do not need to RSVP twice as we will merge the RSVP lists.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Don't forget to RSVP if you would like to join us.

results.description:
I'll be bringing a review of a Charles Williams book from the New Yorker Magazine to share.   Charles Williams was one of the lesser known Inklings.

Williams' interest in mystical topics, he was initiated into a spinoff of the Golden Dawn,  makes his works interesting for this time of year.  Celtic folklore says the Season of Samhain (Halloween) is when the veil between the worlds is thin and we can see into another dimension.  A good time of to take a look at Williams' work. "..By the way, this Golden Dawn has no connection to the Greek political party and included such notables as nobel prize laureate W. B. Yeats and opera singer Florence Farr.
results.name: An Inkling for Magic-Charles Williams Friends of Tolkien & Fantasy Meetup

results.description:
Love, Fire and Transformation
Evening with Jeannie Zandi

Thursday, October 15, 7-9 pm

Clinton Cameo Studios

307 W. 43rd Street

New York City

</a>

Sliding scale: $15-20  No one turned away for lack of funds

Contact: Arlene [masked] or[masked]

Join Jeannie and friends for an exploration into the potent depth of what's often overlooked in the moment: Being.  Jeannie's gift for inviting people to join her in resting and rooted presence evokes a deep meeting with oneself and reality.  Within that, Jeannie's humor and iconoclasm serve to bring people into an understanding that is beyond the intellectual.  Through silent and guided meditation, spontaneous talks and exchange with participants, Jeannie will host a space of clarity and warmth where the true richness of life can be experienced, and your innermost spiritual questions can be met fully.  Come join us!

Jeannie Zandi is the director of Living as Love, a nonprofit organization dedicated to seeding a culture of the Heart on the planet, inspiring, teaching and supporting people to live from their essence as Love.  A year before the birth of her daughter, Jeannie was plunged into a dark night of the soul that culminated in a radical shift of consciousness. She is known for her fearless clarity, tender mercy toward humanness, and a juicy, poetic and often humorous style that draws from Advaita Vedanta, Sufism, Christian mysticism and the ongoing revelation of fully engaged living. Residing in Colorado, she travels widely in the US and Canada, bringing a down-to-earth embodied teaching of living as love.

<a href="http://www.jeanniezandi.com">www.jeanniezandi.com

https://www.facebook.com/Living.as.Love
results.name: Evening with Jeannie Zandi - Thur., Oct. 15, 2015 (7-9 pm)
