results.description:
In The Mirror of Death: An Introduction to the Tibetan Buddhist Understanding of Death and Dying

This 8-week course guides participants through the essential teachings on dying and death from the Buddhist tradition of Tibet. It offers a glimpse of this practical wisdom and sacred inspiration, which is so beneficial for today’s world. The universal message of these teachings speaks to people from all walks of life and is relevant for those of any spiritual tradition or none. They show us how we can face uncertainty and change, transform difficulty and fear, prepare for death and support others to die with dignity.

The course is open to everyone. However, registration is limited to 15 people.

Some books you may find helpful for the course:

The Tibetan Book of Living and Dying by Sogyal Rinpoche

Facing Death and Finding Hope by Christine Longaker

Eight Thursday evenings: September 24 – November 19 (no class on October 22)

7:00PM – 9:00PM

Course Fee:$125.00

Please register at

https://crm.usa.rigpa.org/civicrm/event/register?reset=1&id=149
results.name: In The Mirror of Death (8 week course @ Rigpa)

results.description:
NEW MONTHLY SERIES ‘INDIA’S NEW WAVE’ CELEBRATING CONTEMPORARY INDIAN CINEMA LAUNCHES THIS THURSDAY! 


India produces more films annually than any other country, and there is a wide variety of work in numerous languages. Museum of the Moving Image will present a new monthly series, India’s New Wave, to showcase this work by some of the most exciting voices in contemporary Indian cinema today. 


The series opens THIS THURSDAY, October 15 @ 7PM, with Bombay Velvet, a brilliant ode to American gangster films with 1960s jazz-era Bombay as the backdrop. The film is co-edited by Martin Scorsese’s long-time collaborator Thelma Schoonmaker; directed by Anurag Kashyap, one of the pioneers of India’s independent cinema; and features Ranbir Kapoor and the music of Amit Trivedi.

"BOMBAY VELVET" October 15 @ 7PM

Tickets: $12 ($9 for senior citizens and students)

Use code INDIASNEWAVELAUNCH for 20% off admission. 

Seating is limited so reserve your ticket in advance TODAY.

More info + Tickets: http://www.movingimage.us/india

See you there!


Geoffrey
results.name: Movie Night: Bombay Velvet

A hit at this summer’s Fantasia Film Festival (which called MOMENTUM a "captivating action thriller…filled with spectacular stunts and bare-fisted fury"), MOMENTUM stars Olga Kurylenko (QUANTUM OF SOLACE), James Purefoy (THE FOLLOWING) and Morgan Freeman. Directed by Stephen S. Campanelli, a long-time Clint Eastwood collaborator, MOMENTUM was written by Adam Marcus (JASON GOES TO HELL) and Debra Sullivan, who last penned the hit film TEXAS CHAINSAW 3D.


For those unfamiliar, here’s the pulse-pounding story of MOMENTUM…

When Alex (Kurylenko), an infiltration expert with a secret past, accidentally reveals her identity during what should have been a routine heist, she quickly finds herself mixed up in a government conspiracy and entangled in a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with a master assassin (Purefoy) and his team of killers. Armed with her own set of lethal skills, Alex looks to exact revenge for her murdered friends while uncovering the truth.


www.fangoria.com/new/nyc-free-fangoria-screening-of-action-flick-momentum-hits-1015


The Fango screening of MOMENTUM will be a free show. To get tickets, send an email to [masked]. You must list "MOMENTUM" as your subject line and provide us your full name. Offer is good for you and one guest. Seating is first come, first shat, but not guaranteed. This exclusive event is presented by our pals at Starz Digital, who releases MOMENTUM to theaters, iTunes and On Demand on October 16th.

My friend and Fango editor emeritus Tony Timpone will be hosting the show.

https://youtu.be/wAq_hngebFk
results.name: FREE screening of MOMENTUM, a non-stop action flick hosted by Fangoria!

results.description:
Please note the venue change.

Join Be Social Change and the New York Corporate Social Responsibility Meetup on Thursday, October 15th for a panel discussion on "The Future of Corporate Social Responsibility - Can Business Be Used as a Force for Good?" as we explore the trends, challenges, and best practices in CSR.


There is a growing expectation that businesses take into account not only their bottom line but also the impact they have on society and the environment. Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is a business practice that involves company initiatives that give back - for example, donating a portion of proceeds to charity, minimizing carbon emissions and waste, organizing employee volunteer opportunities, or initiating cause-marketing programs - each designed to use business as a force for good.

With more companies integrating CSR practices, this panel discussion will explore the challenges and opportunities of using business to positively impact society and the environment. How do businesses meet these imperatives while maintaining their economic competitiveness? How can they measure, track, and report on the impact that CSR initiatives have on both their community and their bottom-line? And how will these trends affect the future of how we do business?

Drinks and snacks will be provided!

Sign up now at bit.ly/BSCFoCSR

Meetup members receive 50% off tickets with the discount code "CSRNY50."

SCHEDULE
6:30-7:00pm - Doors open, Check-in
7:00-8:30pm - Program, Panel Discussion, Q&A
8:30 - Closing & Networking

FEATURED PANELISTS
Aman Singh, VP of Business + Social Purpose, Edelman
David Korngold, Manager of Advisory Services, BSR
Vera Oziransky, Project Manager, The Vitality Institute
Laura James, HR Manager, UPS
Marcos Salazar (Moderator), Co-Founder & Executive Director, Be Social Change
results.name: The Future of CSR: Can Business Be Used as a Force for Good?

Hey Everyone!

Better Off Bowling is kicking off a new season on Sunday afternoons this Fall and I thought I'd create an event for our group since there was a lot of interest previously! We played last season and it was a blast! Just to be clear, you have to register/pay through the leagues website in order to be a part of the league, not just RSVP here! :)

They've given us an amazing discount for the season! To get $10 off the regular registration price use code FALLAWENYC15 . I've already created a team for our group called Snakes on the Lane - here's the link: https://www.betteroffbowling.com/teams/5507-Snakes-on-the-Lane

and you can get info on the season here: http://www.Betteroffbowling.com/newyork/reg

Also, there are some other group members who are making their own teams with friends, so feel free to do that as well. It doesn't matter if you're a horrible bowler or a great one as this league is mainly about fun and meeting people, so that's right up our alley! PLUS! If Sundays don’t work for you there is a Monday night option as well! We have a team with the same name in that league you can join! 


This is the info on the meetup below! We get $10 off with the promo code, but the meetup ends soon!!

</a>

<a href="http://www.betteroffbowling.com/newyork/reg">

Better Off Bowling, New York‘s Biggest Social Bowling League! 

Hundreds of fun young professionals (20's and 30's), co-ed and non-competitive, and at only $79 (with discount code) for the entire season, incredibly affordable!

Includes:

- 6 weeks of coed social bowling (1-3 games each week) at Frames Bowling Lounge!

- Bowling on Sunday Afternoons: Oct 18, Oct 25, Nov 1, Nov 8, Nov 15, Nov 22
OR Monday Nights: Oct 19, Oct 26, Nov 2, Nov 9, Nov 16, Nov 23

- Hundreds of fun bowlers with an awesome after-bowling bar scene!

- Bowling shoe rentals and league Management

- Drink specials, after-bowling bar, and Happy Hours!

Register While Spots Last!

results.description:
3D Thursday is a weekly open house that is more 3D printing focused, but visit us anyway even if you think 3D printers are overhyped. It’s a good opportunity to learn what Hack Manhattan is about in a less crowded environment.

Come hang out, or bring a project to work on with our tools.

Some 3D Thursdays coincide with Electronics Night, a more structured study group that focuses on some topic in electronics.

Friends,

Join us this Thursday, October 15 @ Empire Rooftop for our International Thursdays. This venue is conveniently located near Lincoln Center. You are guaranteed to have a fun time on this rooftop.

Get to meet a fun and diverse group of people.

Empire rooftop is one of the best rooftops in NYC! 

This event is from 7-11pm.

Admission is free for all members. Just mention Rory's List to the door person upon arrival.

Dress code is business casual.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Don't forget to RSVP if you would like to join us.

You are always welcome to invite your family, friends and colleagues.


Do you like fashion show? There will be a fashion show that evening!


We look forward in seeing you this Thursday.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Rory

results.description:
The New York City Sea Gypsies 

Present

“Ghost Ships of the Great Lakes”  

By Becky Kagan Schott

Description:

For hundreds of years ships have used the Great Lakes and for hundreds of years ships have collided with other ships in fog, burned in fires, storms or just vanished. The ships range from schooners to freighters and most of them sit on the lake bottom in the cold, fresh water just frozen in time. The names of the ships can still been seen on some of the wooden hulls, rigging on the masts that are still standing 70ft tall, and dozens of artifacts to be seen on each wreck. The lakes offer something for everyone from snorkeling to technical diving and each wreck has a story to tell. 

About the Speaker:

Becky Schott is a multiple Emmy Award-winning underwater cameraman, photographer, and accomplished technical diver whose work can be seen on major networks including National Geographic, Discovery Channel, and the Travel Channel. She is co-owner of Liquid Productions, Inc, specializing in capturing quality imagery in challenging environments. Her projects have taken her all over the globe from exploring virgin wrecks in over 300 feet of water in the Great Lakes, rappelling into caves in the jungle, filming under ice in the Arctic to diving cage-less with great white sharks.

Becky is extremely passionate about sharing the underwater world with others both through her imagery or teaching someone to dive. She's been teaching scuba since 2000 and is an active technical diving instructor and TDI Rebreather Instructor. In her spare time she’s participated in several exploration projects around the world that have earned her a place as a Fellow in the Explorers Club and in 2013 she was inducted into the Women Divers Hall of Fame.

www.LiquidProductions.com  /  www.MegDiver.com

****  Note:  The official  Club Annual  Meeting  as per our bylaws, where  club  where elections will take place,  will be held in  November  *****

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
